job_title: Data Analyst - Product and Acquisition focus
job_description:
Wanderu is the leading ground travel search in North America and soon the rest of the world. Our mission is to allow people to travel between any two places focusing on the hardest to find modes of transportation primarily bus and train. This is your opportunity to join an exciting, fast-paced startup environment and make a difference in the world, one traveler at a time. We have seen tremendous... growth in both sales and new opportunities in 2022 coming out of the pandemic and we are looking to expand our team to capture this wave of travel demand.

Wanderu is a company that values and promotes diversity, founded by first generation immigrants and led by a 40% female executive team including our CEO. Wanderu is a fully remote company that supports our employee’s choice to find their best fitting work environment.

We hire people who are driven, solutions-focused, and passionate about their work. Our employees never fill a single role and always rise to new challenges with excitement and curiosity. Wanderu is a data company first where everyone appreciates and expects decisions to be made based on precise analysis of the far reaching data sets we collect.

We are looking to add a Data Analyst who will be involved with all aspects of Wanderu’s digital media channels, user acquisition, inventory analysis and on-site optimization. You’ll be an integral part of expanding our existing digital media strategy and building an optimal user experience. This unique role combines the data-oriented side of digital marketing with seeking out market and product opportunities in large scale data sets.

The ideal candidate will be a master of multi-tasking who considers themselves highly analytical and is comfortable spending a large portion of their time analyzing data, presenting results and implementing solutions that are based on those findings.

Responsibilities
• Analyze the conversion funnel to identify barriers to be removed and features to be implemented in order to create a seamless user experience
• Work directly with the acquisition team to help identify opportunities and trends in campaigns targeting millions of customers.
• Ideate opportunities for optimization by translating user behavior and site interactions into A/B and multivariate tests to be run on the site or in-app
• Help our teams operate smarter by creating self service access to their key performance data via dashboards and alerts.
• Analyze inventory gaps and work directly with our supply team to create new travel supply options.
• Work directly with the executive team to analyze and develop business case analysis for new strategic projects
• Work directly with data engineers to source and optimize how and what data we warehouse and improve query performance.

Qualifications
• Expert in Excel, SQL and Google Analytics
• Strong experience using Snowflake or similar products
• Strong experience with proper A/B testing and other performance analysis methods
• Ability to connect large data sets and translate trends into actionable insights
• Minimum 3-5 years of experience working on a digital product
• Ability to identify, manage and make sound recommendations to peers and management.

Bonus Qualifications
• Knowledge of Snowplow and DBT
• Knowledge of R, Python or Node
• Experience in ecommerce or other large scale consumer environments
• Knowledge of paid, organic and/or email marketing best practices.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status

job_description:
We’re Ookla, the company behind Speedtest, Downdetector, and an ever-expanding suite of connectivity tools. Our team is a group of people brought together through passion and inspired by possibility. We are looking for team members who enjoy solving complex problems, are motivated to challenge themselves, and are delighted with turning clever ideas into unique products.

Millions of tests are... performed through our products and thousands of data points are collected globally every day. With all this usage comes countless ways to dissect and analyze our data, and plenty of exciting opportunities to optimize our monetization strategy. When you work for us, you are using Ookla data and insights to further our mission to improve connectivity for all.

Ookla’s data science team is looking for a data analyst to help us dive deep to analyze, understand, and communicate key insights about internet access and performance around the world. Our company, known for Speedtest and Downdetector, is a team of passionate individuals who have turned clever ideas into unique products and a thriving business. Globally, millions of tests are performed every day across the Speedtest ecosystem. All that usage provides countless ways to dissect and analyze our data. It also empowers us to help make the internet better, faster, and more accessible for everyone. If you crave the chance to do your best work in a flexible work environment where we value individuality and fun as much as we value talent, we want to hear from you.

As a data analyst, your primary focus will be enabling internal and external customers to gain insights from the vast Ookla dataset. Successful applicants will have an inquisitive nature, a creative approach to solving problems, excellent communication skills, and a strong drive for data advocacy. We’re especially interested in candidates who also have experience with time series analysis, geospatial clustering, and anomaly detection.

We are committed to providing you a flexible work environment where individuality, fun, and talent are all valued equally. If you consider yourself innovative, adept at collaboration, and you care deeply about the work you do, we want to talk!

Responsibilities
• Identify significant patterns in large, unlabeled data sets
• Support teams across the business through exploratory analysis, custom reporting, and quality assurance
• Work closely with technical account managers to resolve customer data questions
• Create tools for identifying data trends and telling stories

We are looking for the right person, not the exact list of requirements. If you believe your life experience has prepared you for similar challenges, we’d like to hear from you.
• Collaborative mindset with a strong drive to learn from and teach others
• The ability to communicate and tell stories with data through data visualization, statistical analysis, and writing
• Strong familiarity with R (or Python) for data analysis and SQL for accessing large data sets
• Experience applying statistical methods to real-world challenges
• Proven history of exceptional customer service and advocacy
• Experience with internet, cellular, and broadband technologies nice to have

We care deeply about each other and the work we do, and our perks are just one way we demonstrate this. We offer a comprehensive benefits package, including (but not limited to):
• 401(k) matching,
• Flex Friday,
• unlimited PTO,
• ESPP options,
• health/dental/vision insurance coverage, and
• enhanced parental leave.

You will have the best hardware, software, and tools available for you to do your work, and we provide excellent flexibility for working remotely as time and responsibilities allow. To promote your success and growth, we offer tuition reimbursement, educational opportunities, and anti-racism and LGBTQIA+ resource libraries. Transit passes, team happy hours and activities, and gym reimbursements are only a few of the additional, outstanding perks available to you at Ookla!

If you’re passionate about joining the work we’re doing, we welcome your application and encourage applicants with both traditional and non-traditional experience that makes them an excellent candidate for the role. We strongly believe diversity of all kinds makes us better. We are an equal opportunity employer actively working to build an inclusive workforce at all levels of the company. [Read our latest diversity report from our parent company here.]

We want to ensure candidates have everything they need throughout our application and hiring process. If you have any individual needs related to disability or accessibility, we encourage you to contact and let us know how we can best accommodate you.

The salary range reflected is an estimate of average pay for the primary location. This range may vary if an offer is made for work in a different location. Salary range for this role: $100,000 - $120,000

job_description:
About Vouch:

Insurance... sounds slow, old-fashioned, and unexciting. Exactly. Insurance is broken, and it's failing fast-moving, innovative startups...

Vouch is a new, technology-first insurance company backed with $160M in funding from world-class investors. Like Stripe for payments or Brex for credit cards, Vouch is creating the go-to business insurance for high-growth companies.

We're doing this by making insurance fast, responsive, and focused on our customers -high growth and innovative companies. Instead of printed PDF applications and week-long waits, Vouch is building new technology to solve real problems, writing policies that actually cover relevant startup scenarios, and designing simple experiences in an otherwise frustrating industry.

What does a work environment look like at Vouch?

Vouch is a Virtual First Workplace with office locations in SF, Chicago, and NYC . This role can be based anywhere in the U.S as long as you can work our Vouch core collaboration hours (8:30 am-2:30 pm Pacific Time.)

Role Responsibilities:

As an insurance company, data is at the core of everything we do at Vouch. Data and analysis are critical to improving insurance design, underwriting, and outcomes for our clients. Data also drives our business operations and our financial decisions. As a Data Analyst at Vouch, you’ll have the unique opportunity to build the foundational data structure, tools, and models to help all of our functions become increasingly data-driven. You will be part of the Analytics team and sit cross-functionally working closely with the data team, finance, biz ops and product managers that work across all of our functions.

You will work with our teams + stakeholders to build and maintain key data sets and dashboards, and be the go-to person when we’re looking to do deep analysis or answer thorny data-driven business decisions; you’re dogmatic in chasing down the answer, even when it isn’t easy.

Job Duties:
• Build dashboards (in Mode) and key data sets to empower stakeholders to perform their own analysis
• Work across teams to define key metrics, develop dashboards, track metric progress, investigate changes in metrics, and propose next steps
• Influence teams through presentation of data-based recommendations
• Help scale the business by turning one-off analyses (variable cost) into automated processes (fixed cost)
• Grit: you are goal-oriented, purpose-driven, and are perseverant about achieving their goals, even in the face of adversity

About you:
• 3-6 years of experience working as a data analyst, data scientist, consulting, banking, or equivalent quantitative analytical role
• Bachelor’s or advanced degree in statistics, math, economics, computer science, finance, or equivalent practical experience
• Expert SQL skills, and experience with BI tools (Mode, Tableau, Looker, Qlikview, etc.)
• Strong communication skills and the ability to explain complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences; you can explain your analysis to the leadership team or the BDR team, and level set appropriately
• Experience working directly with business teams to define metrics, analyze problems, and propose solutions
• Familiar with a statistical modeling language (such as Python or R)
• Are excited to dig into our business processes to understand how data is generated
• Are eager to learn new tools and improve your technical skill set
• Have empathy with our clients and internal partners
• Are comfortable with multi-stakeholder environment and context-switching
• Are willing to go above and beyond their duties
• Take initiative in problem solving and chasing down solutions
• Have experience performing business driver analysis, identifying opportunities and making recommendations to stakeholders
• 1+ years of professional experience with Python or R

Nice to have:
• Insurance or financial services background
• Exposure to and passion for early-stage startups and/or high growth environments

Vouch provides a number of benefits to help you bring your best self to work:
• Competitive compensation and equity packages
• Health, dental, and vision insurance
• Parental leave
• Flexible vacation time (Unlimited PTO)
• Wellness allowance ($80/month)
• Technology allowance ($100/month)

Salary Range:

The pay range for this role is: $120,000 to $140,000 per year.

Our salary ranges are based on paying competitively for our size and industry and are one part of our total compensation package that also includes benefits and other perks. We also include stock options in all compensation packages and believe all Vouch employees should have the opportunity to become owners in the company.

Individual pay decisions are based on a number of factors, including qualifications for the role, experience level, skill set, location, and business need. The base pay range provided is subject to change and may be modified in the future.

Vouch believes in putting our people first and building a diverse team is at the front of everything that we do. We welcome people from different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate the diversity of our growing team.

If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to recruiting @ vouch.us

job_description:
Minimum qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
• 4 years of experience as a project or program manager...
• 4 years of industry experience in data analysis, modeling, SQL, and presentation development.

Preferred qualifications:
• MBA.
• 3 years of experience in manipulating data sets using SQL or other programming/scripting languages.
• Experience building data dashboards and presentations.
• Experience working in an operations-oriented organization with outside call centers or other vendor management environments.
• Knowledge of the full recruiting cycle, compliance/equal opportunities best practices, and of People Operations programs/processes (e.g., recruiting lifecycle, contingent workforce management, etc.).
• Knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., DASNav, Tableau, etc.).

Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. Whether you are making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you have an eye on the staffing needs of Google and the broader hiring landscape. You are focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for Google's long-term hiring needs, and work across a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams. You are both scrappy and resourceful, creative and driven -- and excited to share the magic of working at Google.

The Online Recruiting team helps to drive Google's approach to reviewing online candidates and employee referrals for our active pipeline. Our team aims to provide our Recruiting teams with a pipeline of qualified, diverse talent for our business clients and partners.

As a Program Operations Management Analyst, you will deliver project workstreams by making key contributions, including conducting strategic analyses and translating/defining business questions into simple analyses, evaluation metrics, or statistical models. As you work within one or more teams, you'll address conflicts between the goals and objectives of stakeholders by understanding the nature of the problem and underlying assumptions. You will work with data analytics, analytical tools, statistical methods, and business contexts to analyze data. You'll advise team members in the Analyst ecosystem on their specialty areas by developing expertise within a People Operations domain.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

Additional Information

(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $109,000 - $117,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
• Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

Responsibilities
• Manage the execution of data-oriented analysis to design metrics, synthesize information, solve problems, and influence business decision-making by presenting insights and market trends to the Project team.
• Support the team by creating and presenting automated data reporting tools and templates to enhance communication with different stakeholders.
• Contribute to management of strategic relationships with key stakeholders to deliver/manage operations and processes with minimal guidance.
• Ensure data dashboards used by our recruiting partners include all in-scope requisitions and make sure that they are constantly evolved and maintained so that users get the right level of support. Ensure focus on user experience.
• Answer questions within service level agreement (SLA), resolve query exceptions and escalations, address customer-facing queues, determine highest-volume ticket types, and streamline/eliminate accordingly with limited guidance

job_description:
Job Title: Business Analyst - Global Service Operations

Responsibilities...

The primary responsibility of this role is to design and ongoing process review and improvements to the Service Sales process and tool sets. The role will collaborate closely with cross functional teams on defining and the validation of business requirements, alignment, testing and change management.

Location: Remote USA

Key Tasks
• Business Process
• Review business process requirements for quoting / contracts
• Identify improvement opportunities
• Define business requirements and use cases
• Theater escalation support
• Participate with IT and business teams on
• Functional design
• User Acceptance testing
• Develop, implement, and ma nage service sales quoting, process, and guidelines
• Drive change management with global, theater and cross functional stakeholders
• Review business KPIs for trends or gaps
• Data hygiene and management

Job Requirements:
• 4-6 years of business experience preferably within a CS environment with Services and Subscription sales, renewals, and contracts business processes.
• Hands on experience with CPQ and CRM applications such as Oracle, SFDC, SAP
• Strong working knowledge of master and transactional data – Customers, Partners, Products, Installed base, Opportunities, Quotes, Orders, Service Contracts.
• Strong organizational and program management skills, react to changing priorities
• Able to work effectively as part of a cross-functional team within and outside CS

Education
• BS/BA Degree required

job_description:
Every day, we work together for what matters – bold, swift, and equitable climate action.

ABOUT THE ROLE...

The Transportation Markets team works to support meaningful pathways to reduce transportation emissions for a wide range of partners including corporations, utilities companies, 3rd party contractors, fleet operations, logistics providers, municipalities, public transportation agencies and more. 3Degrees helps clients understand the range of solutions and how to best leverage them to meet their unique business needs and sustainability goals. We are seeking a highly detail oriented Business Analyst to focus on business process improvement, customer service excellence and cross functional, collaborative multi faceted projects to join our growing innovative, mission driven organization.

This is a full-time, non-exempt role reporting to the Director, Transportation Markets within the Environmental Markets division. This position is located in our San Francisco, CA or Portland, OR office. Exceptional remote candidates may also be considered within the United States.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

The Business Analyst joins the Environmental Markets team which manages the environmental commodity business at 3Degrees. This role supports the Director, Transportation Markets by ensuring regulatory reporting processes are completed accurately and on time and that commodity value is tracked and reported on accurately. Position responsibilities include:
• Oversee the onboarding of new partners within Transportation Markets
• Oversee the reporting processes in each Clean Fuels Standard jurisdiction
• Work with the Project Operations team to ensure data are received and processed timely
• Work with the Trade Operations team to ensure deliveries and receipts are made timely
• Ensure commodity value is tracked accurately
• Track market prices to accurately price environmental commodities
• Decide the best use of environmental commodities based on market conditions
• Leverage a deep understanding of contractual relationships to calculate and report on commodity costs
• Coordinate with the commodities traders to ensure portfolio positions and value are tracked accurately
• Identify opportunities to improve existing systems and processes

ABOUT YOU

You have demonstrated experience efficiently supporting business processes with an eye for detail and a knack for extracting simplicity from the complex. You are outcomes focussed and strive to exceed expectations. Your desire for excellence drives you to find new and innovative ways of doing things, and allows you to adapt as conditions change. Individuals with the following qualifications have an excellent opportunity to thrive in this position:
• BA/BS degree in a relevant discipline or equivalent combination of professional experience and education
• 2 - 3 years of professional experience in a similar role
• An understanding of transportation commodities markets preferred
• Ability to work in a team-based environment balancing competing demands toward mutual goals
• Excellent presentation skills. Must be able to succinctly convey information to other team members
• Capability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and maintain composure under pressure
• Strong independent learning skills coupled with a successful track record of self-driven analytical investigations
• Advanced proficiency in Excel and diligent attention to detail
• Self-motivated, with a genuine desire to accelerate the growth of environmental markets in the US and abroad
• Experience using SQL or Tableau is a plus

HOW WE DEFINE SUCCESS

Within 60 days
• You clearly demonstrate an understanding of existing markets and commercial structures with an understanding of commodity flows and value creation

Within 120 days
• You have taken responsibility for calculating commodities costs based on partner agreements and market conditions

Within 180 days
• You are the primary owner of and decision maker for commodity flows within Transportation Markets

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS
• Compensation: The starting base pay for this position is $55,800 - $84,000 in the US. The total compensation package for the successful candidate in this role may exceed the base pay as it includes other incentive pay. The base pay is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range is subject to change and may be modified in the future
• Benefits: this position is eligible for a benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401k, flexible paid time off and more. Additional information regarding the benefits available for this position can be found at: https://jobs.jobvite.com/3degrees/jobs/jointheteam
• Supplemental Pay: this position is eligible for discretionary bonus programs including the company’s profit sharing program and an annual team Bonus Pool
• This compensation and benefits information is based on 3Degrees’ good faith estimate as of the date of publication and may be modified in the future

OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY, INCLUSION AND EQUITY

3Degrees is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where different perspectives contribute to better solutions. 3Degrees welcomes people regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or gender expression, age, sex, pregnancy, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other category protected by law.

#LI-Remote
#LI-AY1

job_description:
The Data Analyst offers intelligence and insight to support marketing and other divisions. This position is responsible for thoroughly understanding the organization's data infrastructure, attribution modeling processes, and business needs to help translate complex marketing data into actionable insights.

Responsibilities...

Develop and maintain the marketing attribution framework and inform marketing media mix decisions.
Analyze large data sets from multiple sources to identify trends, root causes, and business improvement opportunities, and visualize those findings using traditional and digital analytics tools.
Help marketing teams Improve marketing campaign performance – especially as it relates to marketing attribution.
Use systems like Tableau and Alteryx to produce and maintain regular dashboards and visualize data from various data sources.
Support a fact-based culture to drive decision-making and marketing investments.
Support business units in understanding and validating results; help tell the data story by extracting actionable insights from complex data.
Support Business Intelligence data efforts through quality assurance and due diligence.
Enhance data collection procedures to support and improve the validity of reporting.
Provide ad hoc analyses for various business units.
Other duties and projects as assigned.

Experience

Bachelor’s degree in CompSci or Marketing; or equivalent relevant work experience
At least three (2) years of experience with big data analytics.
Experience with data science or working on large, complex data sets is preferred.
Experience with marketing, product-based data analysis.
Experience functioning in a highly matrixed organization.
Experience with data analysis and visualization tools like Tableau, Alteryx, and MSSQL
Strong data analysis skills and mathematical-statistical tool proficiency.
High attention to detail and high level of accuracy.
Professional integrity is necessary to maintain confidentiality.
Strong planning skills and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Excellent verbal, and written communication skills.
Ability to complete assigned duties within critical deadlines.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook).
Proficiency with modern reporting platforms and tools like Tableau and Alteryx.
Ability to grasp complex platform concepts and business models, in a digital context.

Preferred

Notable accomplishments in data storytelling & customer demographics data.
Exposure to Google cloud and big query
Exposure to predictive analytics.
Tableau Desktop Certified preferred
Ability to derive and present compelling stories based on data and metrics.
Ability to build professional relationships across reporting lines

job_description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way... When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.
• Create and develop metrics in an objective and sustainable manner to identify performance trends and issues in a succinct and visual manner
• Deliver high quality and accurate results in a timely manner
• Prioritize day-to-day tasks and monthly/quarterly/annual deliverables with ad-hoc requests without impacting quality or timeliness
• As a subject matter expert, the candidate will act in a lead role with cross-functional teams to understand metrics and reporting needs
• The candidate will be involved in metrics needs assessments, along with the planning, collection, analysis, interpretation, and reporting of both quality and productivity metrics
• Prepares and delivers reports, recommendations or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas in procurement operations
• Managing quality metrics & assist in standardization / continuous improvement and reengineering initiatives
• Ensure high degree of team cohesiveness & engagement
• Ensure compliance to standard American reporting techniques
• Predictive Analysis and visualizations for senior leadership MIS
• Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
• Deliver high quality and accurate results in a timely manner
• Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
• Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
• Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
• Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance

When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture.

job_description:
The candidate must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy, big picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. The Commercial Operations Analyst will operate with a high level of autonomy on projects while maintaining excellent communications on status and progress to department and division leadership.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities...
• Partner with sales team to fulfill quote requests and process orders as established by department policies and procedures within a timely manner
• Perform weekly and monthly audits of key data points to ensure data integrity
• Work closely with the other departments (i.e. finance, contracts, sales) within Data Innovations to develop services, continuously improve the quote to cash process, and resolve any disputed order items
• Serve as Salesforce Subject Matter Expert by understanding all aspects of Salesforce.com configuration and technical/functional capabilities, including:
• all changes and potential system implications related to Salesforce release upgrades
• perform system testing to ensure Sales enablement tools and new enhancements are performing properly
• Improve user experience and utilization by engaging the teams that we support to uncover training opportunities or areas of improvement with our systems and processes.
• Support the standardization and implementation of channel processes, policies, and procedures.
• Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies
• Other duties as assigned

Requirements

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
• Sales and/or Commercial Operations experience
• Proficient with Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, Word)
• Salesforce experience
• Strong attention to detail
• Ability to be self-motivated and manage multiple priorities/projects
• Proven ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams
• Must comply with and pass initial background check and drug screening, as well as subsequent background checks, drug screenings and vaccine requirements as required by customer contracts.
• Ability to follow DI’s policies and procedures and system usage practices
• Must comply with Company vaccination policy

Education and/or Experience
• Bachelors Degree and at least 2 years relevant working experience in sales or commercial operations

-OR-
• Associates Degree and at least 4 years relevant working experience in sales or commercial operations

-OR-
• At least 6 years relevant working experience in commercial operations

Physical Requirements/Working Conditions:

While performing duties of this job, the employee is predominately functioning in a sedentary light office position with high frequency of telephone communication, keyboarding, and computer.

Preferred skills and experience:

In addition to the above requirements, the ideal employee/candidate will have experience with the following:
• Oracle CPQ Experience
• Clinical Laboratory experience
• Experience with Microsoft SharePoint
• Prior use of Data Innovations’ Products

Supervision Level

This person may report directly to the Director of Commercial Operations or the Manager of Commercial Operations

job_title: Revenue Operations Analyst, GTM Strategic Planning and Analysis
job_description:
Formstack improves people’s lives with practical solutions to their everyday work. We are looking for the next Stacker to help us accomplish this mission.

Formstack is a remote-first company with team members who live and work across the U.S., Canada, and the globe. We offer more than just a job; we provide a community where you can learn, grow, and thrive your way. Join a dynamic and diverse... team that values relationships as much as results. Come build what matters with Formstack.

Dan Swimm, Vice President of Revenue Operations at Formstack, is looking to hire someone who will complement and strengthen the team.

What You’ll Be Doing

In this role, you will be part of the RevOps team and play a key role in defining, building and advancing Formstack’s go-to-market strategy. Your mission will be to design and build financial/operational models, support strategic planning, and deliver quantitative analyses on a broad range of business topics. The focus goes beyond manipulating spreadsheets and pulling data – it is to tackle complex business problems, build compelling data-driven stories and become a trusted business advisor to a variety of cross-functional stakeholders. This is a new role with a unique opportunity to influence strategic decisions that will have a significant impact on the growth and profitability of the business.

How You’ll Succeed
• Deliver accurate and flexible financial/operational models that answer key business growth, headcount and financial planning questions.
• Clearly and concisely present strategic and tactical recommendations; develop compelling presentations for both internal and external customers.
• Partner with senior business leaders on solving complex business challenges and provide relevant scenario modeling and data-driven insights.
• Design, develop and maintain compelling, accurate, and reliable analytical reports.
• Become a trusted advisor to key go-to-market stakeholders and provide ad-hoc reporting, data extracts, and analyses.
• Assist with and manage frequent ad hoc projects to support senior management and business decisions.
• Help design and implement best practices for scalable and efficient business growth.
• Own the go-to-market Board reporting package alongside finance.

What We’re Looking For
• Passion for improving business outcomes through data and analytics solutions.
• Advanced analytical and financial modeling skills.
• Proven track record of building accurate financial/operational go-to-market models.
• Experience with variable headcount forecasting and planning.
• Advanced knowledge of MS Excel required, including complex nested functions, lookups, pivot tables, and modeling.
• Experience with macros, scripting, and SQL are a strong plus.
• Good understanding of statistical methods for forecasting and estimation.
• Strong communication skills, including the ability to summarize and visualize complex analyses that tell a compelling story.
• 3+ years of working experience in finance, analytics, business planning, including education in a related field.
• Experience with SaaS businesses preferred.

Salary Range

$75,000 – $90,000 per year (USD) + bonus up to 5% of base salary
• **This is a remote position.***

What Formstack Offers for Full-Time Employees in the US and Canada(exclude Quebec):

– Competitive health plans, Dental, Vision, Disability, and Life Insurance Benefits for US and Canadian full-time employees.

– Monthly Health & Wellness and Technology stipends

– Half-day Fridays

– Unlimited PTO for all employees.

– 401k & Roth w/ safe harbor match (the US and Canada)

– The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software, and other tools needed to excel at your job

– Company-paid conferences and extended learning opportunities

– Yearly company and team gatherings

Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. Formstack is dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. if you’re excited about this role, but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Formstack is an equal-opportunity employer. We are passionately committed to equitable hiring and boldly dedicated to diversity in our work and staff. We do not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices based on actual or perceived race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related conditions), age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, uniform service member status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law. Women, people of color, bilingual and bicultural individuals, LGBTQ+ persons, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

All data collected in our application process, from resume collection to application questions, is used for recruitment purposes only. We will store it in our applicant tracking system, Lever, and will not share this data with anyone else. We will keep your data until the role is filled and only continue to store it if we feel you may fit future roles

job_description:
Spokeo is a people search engine that both enlightens and empowers our customers. With over 12 billion records and 14 million visitors per month, we reconnect friends, reunite families, prevent fraud, and more.

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be responsible for working across finance, product, and marketing functions to translate business needs into data-centric solutions. We collect data... from a wide variety of public sources and need someone with a curious mindset who is ready to dive deep to define business rules, identify connections and organize our growing data catalog.

Responsibilities (including estimated time of how much of an average week is spent doing each item - this is subject to change):
• 15% - Learn and apply your knowledge in quantitative analysis, qualitative assessment, and data mining to uncover meaningful insights and recommendations to guide and improve marketing advertising performance, acquisition growth, and audience targeting efforts.
• 15% - Collaborate with product, design, and data science teams to propose hypotheses, formulate experimentation, evaluate performance measures, and suggest potential product, pricing, or customer retention improvements.
• 15% - Educate the business side on available data and proper usage of key KPI metrics
• 15% - Inform business stakeholders on changes to performance trends and translate data insights into meaningful visuals and presentations to deliver findings.
• 15% - Create Tableau dashboards and collaborate with engineers to ensure data quality.
• 10% - Identify potential methods and new usage of available data to support business analysis and customer lifecycle projects
• 10% - Serve as the main communication ambassador for analytics among technology, executive, and business teams on project and analysis outcomes.
• 5% - Inform and support the executive team in ad-hoc data analysis studies

Requirements:
• BS in Math, Statistics, Econometrics, or equivalent experience
• 3+ years of experience with applied methods or quantitative analysis to impact and promote data-driven business decision making
• Proficiency in working with SQL and Python
• Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Domo, or Looker
• Good communication and presentation skills to deliver results to stakeholders
• Team player and willingness to learn

Spokeo extends written offers to candidates who successfully complete their selection process. Spokeo’s offers include a base salary, participation in a company bonus program, stock options, and comprehensive benefits. A final offer will depend on several factors, including, but not limited to: marketplace competition, job leveling, the candidate’s experience, skills, etc.

Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.spokeo.com/recruiting-policy

Spokeo is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Spokeo fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best products, and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

Recruiters or staffing agencies: Spokeo is not obligated to compensate any external recruiter or search firm who presents a candidate or their resume or profile to a Spokeo employee without 1) a current, fully-executed agreement on file, and 2) being assigned to the open position (as a search) via our applicant tracking solution.

#LI-Remote

job_description:
What We Do:

Marketing Operations is a critical role that prioritizes the lead lifecycle, manages day-to-day marketing initiatives, oversees the organization’s MarTech stack, and enables the business with marketing performance insights...

What You’ll Do:

The role will be responsible for guiding, developing, and managing methodology and key performance indicators for marketing operations including email performance and campaign performance. The role will gather and examine reports and data and translate into best practices and enablement strategies for other marketing functions to fine-tune our marketing revenue engine. This role is a critical member of the Marketing team and holds responsibility for driving operational excellence, including performance tracking, lead funnel management, and measurement, database health, and reporting and campaign production process.
• Measure, evaluate, and report on the impact of marketing campaigns to the marketing team
• Provide insights to help the team optimize campaign strategies
• Report on email performance and email marketing excellence
• Investigate roadblocks with lead flow from a systems and business process standpoint
• Participate in strategic projects to help inform growth planning and operationalize select key initiatives

Who You Are:
• 2+ years experience working in operations, analytics, or a similar role preferred
• Skilled in Marketo, Salesforce, Excel, Bizible/Marketo Measure preferred
• Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and optimization mindset
• Ability to escalate and communicate risks to management and relevant stakeholders
• Demonstrated ability to translate business and platform requirements into marketing campaigns/MarTech knowledge
• Experience with database hygiene and excellence such as segmentation and measurements
• Maintain a learning mindset and the ability to understand concepts and systems
• Strong communication skills and experience working in cross-functional teams
• Self-starter and excellent in self-management, experience in working with remote teams
• Excellent communicator and cross-functional partner
• Highly data-directed
• You’re empathetic and work to understand your audience
• Creative and experimental. You love problem-solving, navigating ambiguity, and running experiments to test and validate new ideas
• Excited about Calm’s mission and passionate about mental health and wellness
The anticipated salary range for this position is $102,300 - $143,200. The base salary range represents the low and high end of Calm’s salary range for this position. Not all candidates will be eligible for the upper end of the salary range. Exact salary will ultimately depend on multiple factors, which may include the successful candidates skills, experience and other qualifications. This role is also eligible for equity + comprehensive benefits + 401k + flexible time off.

Calm focuses on Mobile, Personal Health, Apps, Health and Wellness, and Leisure. Their company has offices in San Francisco. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees. To date, Calm has raised $115.993M of funding; their latest round was closed on February 2019 at a valuation of $1B.

You can view their website at http://www.calm.com or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn

job_description:
About the Company

Qumulo is the leading file data platform, providing unrivaled freedom, control, and real-time visibility for file data at petabyte scale. Fortune 500 companies, major film studios, and the largest research facilities in the world trust Qumulo to help them innovate with their mission-critical digital files. The Qumulo experience makes file data management simple with continuous... new features and a single, easy to use solution in a customer’s data center or in the public cloud.

Qumulo has a collaborative culture with a strong focus on delivering value to our customers. We are looking for people with a diverse set of experiences to help us fulfill our vision.

See storage made simple at www.qumulo.com

About the Position

As a Revenue Operations Analyst, you’ll have a tremendously impactful role of being responsible over Qumulo’s quote-to-order lifecycle, specifically covering quoting and order management. Reporting to the Director of Revenue Accounting and Operations, you will help build scalable practices and adopt new systems. This is an incredible opportunity to join a highly motivated, fun team poised for success.

Responsibilities
• Responsible for supporting the global Sales organization in the creation of non-standard quote structures in Salesforce.
• Ensure all quotes are processed in a timely, efficient, and accurate manner with strong focus during period-end deadlines.
• Collaborate and manage closely with renewals sales team to drive accurate renewals processing including proper pricing, exceptions approvals and business metrics tracking.
• Understand end-to-end processes across the deal lifecycle, including roles and responsibilities of cross-functional support teams to quickly resolve issues.
• Deliver ad-hoc and weekly business reporting and work with internal stakeholders to streamline the operating processes to support the standard cadence with business stakeholders
• Participate in the recommendation and implementation of new processes across the organization.
• Maintain accurate and clean data including new logo and customer hierarchy structure in Salesforce.
• Partner with sales enablement, accounting, and legal to suggest content to educate sales teams on changes in processes, policies, and best practices to improve process and policy compliance.
• Meet SLAs and prepare metrics to provide business visibility and consistency of practices across teams.
• Ensure sales teams are compliant with internal policies specifically tied to deal structuring.
• Maintain an up-to-date library of processes and resources for Revenue Operation team members.

Desired Skills and Experience
• Bachelor’s degree in finance or accounting preferred
• 5+ years of relevant order management experience
• High growth technology experience, ideally with SaaS contracts
• Familiarity with system optimization/implementation
• Meticulous attention to detail
• Identifying problems and the ability to find solutions
• A keen focus on scale, end-to-end automation and evolving processes for scale and efficiency
• Advanced Excel skills required
• Ability to work on and prioritize multiple projects while meeting goals and deadlines
• Cloud Marketplace experience is plus
• Central Timezone preferred

Key Benefits
The annual pay range for the role is USD $72,000 - $103,500. Individual pay depends on various factors, such as role level, relevant experience and skills, and location. Pay ranges are reviewed and typically updated each year. Offers are made within the pay range applicable at the time. U.S. based employees have access to healthcare benefits, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, wellbeing benefits, flexible time off, and paid holidays, among others.

Other Details
Qumulo is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, military status, or national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law.
• Please note that employment at Qumulo is contingent upon completion of a satisfactory background check.

For more information on our Applicant and Employee Privacy Notice please click on the link below:

https://qumulo.com/applicant-employee-privacy-notice

#LI-Remote

Qumulo has a collaborative culture with a strong focus on delivering value to our customers. Offers are made within the pay range applicable at the time.

job_description:
Description

As a Product Data Analyst, you will be a thought leader within Product for how data and analytics can guide our product decisions. You will work with the assigned product team(s) to produce the analytics and insights needed to create and operate best in class digital products. You will help us build a deep understanding of our customers, how they use our products and how we can... improve that experience.

Key Responsibilities
• Thought Leadership: Work closely with assigned product teams to lead critical analyses such as customer journey mapping, in-product flow analysis, and cohort analysis to guide the product development process.
• Improve Product: Use analytics to find patterns and trends to understand user behavior and identify improvement opportunities
• Implementation: Partner with product and technology to develop measurement plan and ensure we are collecting and integrating relevant data to drive product analytics
• Lead Business Intelligence & Reporting: Partner with key stakeholders to build, deploy and maintain dashboards and reporting to enable operations, insights and decisions.

Basic Qualifications
• 1+ years of hands-on product analytics experience with exposure to agile/scrum process, product backlog grooming, etc.
• Experience analyzing in-product data including analyses such as customer journey mapping, audience profiling/segmentation, cohort/mix analysis
• 2+ years hands-on data analytics experience with one or more of the following tools:
• SQL (traditional or PL)
• Tableau (or similar visualization tool)
• Python, R, or another scripting language
• Experience in going beyond reports/data: driving product management using insights and hypothesis testing

Preferred Qualifications
• 2+ years of hands-on product analytics experience with exposure to agile/scrum process, product backlog grooming, etc.
• 2+ years experience analyzing in-product data including analyses such as customer journey mapping, audience profiling/segmentation, cohort/mix analysis
• 3+ years hands-on data analytics experience with one or more of the following tools:
• SQL (traditional or PL)
• Tableau (or similar visualization tool)
• Python, R, or another scripting language
• 1+ years experience in going beyond reports/data: driving product management using insights and hypothesis testing

The base pay range represents the anticipated low and high end of the pay range for this position. Actual pay rates will vary and will be based on various factors, such as your qualifications, skills, competencies, and proficiency for the role. Base pay is one component of WEX's total compensation package. Most sales positions are eligible for commission under the terms of an applicable plan. Non-sales roles are typically eligible for a quarterly or annual bonus based on their role and applicable plan. WEX's comprehensive and market competitive benefits are designed to support your personal and professional well-being. Benefits include health, dental and vision insurances, retirement savings plan, paid time off, health savings account, flexible spending accounts, life insurance, disability insurance, tuition reimbursement, and more. For more information, check out the "About Us" section.

Salary Pay Range: $77,500.00 - $103,000.00

job_title: Senior Operations Analyst (Chicago, IL or Remote)
job_description:
You have a clear vision of where your career can go. And we have the leadership to help you get there. At CNA, we strive to create a culture in which people know they matter and are part of something important, ensuring the abilities of all employees are used to their fullest potential.
CNA seeks to offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package to our employees that helps them - and... their family members - achieve their physical, financial, emotional and social wellbeing goals.
For a detailed look at CNA's benefits, check out our Candidate's Guide .
Provides operations and other analysis, and plans, monitors and completes complex operations projects ensuring adherence to departmental and corporate strategic direction.
JOB DESCRIPTION:
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Performs a combination of duties in accordance with departmental guidelines:
• Analyzes operations and or other data, and works with management to set and modify operations goals, budget, compliance, staffing allocation and work distribution.
• Develops project plans and schedules using defined procedures, negotiates scope and deliverables with operational procedures and concepts.
• Uses work management tools to facilitate efficient processes and to assess operational performance and quality of staff and service delivery.
• May represent the functional area in meetings with management and other business units.
• Manages expenses for specific projects and ensures budget goals and expenses are met.
• Monitors trends and participates in strategic planning as well as team and quality performance reviews.
• Provides assistance and monitoring to junior level operations analysis staff.
• Works with other departments and may provide technical guidance to others within the department.
• Support Operations initiatives through data analytics by partnering with business leaders in identifying opportunities to build and analyze metrics through data visualizations.
• Collaborates with management, technical staff and subject matter advisors to understand business needs/issues, troubleshoot problems, conduct root cause analysis and develop cost effective resolutions to improve operational efficiency.

May perform additional duties as assigned.
Reporting Relationship
• Manager or above

Skills, Knowledge & Abilities
• Strong industry and company knowledge as well as strong knowledge of the functions performed by the department and team.
• Excellent organizational skills including ability to prioritize, coordinate and manage multiple projects and project teams.
• Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Advanced Excel skills required
• Strong client and team interpersonal and leadership skills with the ability to effectively foster and maintain collaborative relationships with internal and external business partners.
• Good presentation, verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey technical and business issues in a clear, concise and effective manner.
• Ability to exercise professional judgement and assume responsibility for decisions which have an impact on people, costs and quality of service.
• Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
• Solid knowledge of Microsoft Office suite and the ability to learn and utilize other business related software systems.
• Knowledge of contact center applications such as Cisco, Tableau and other business related software a plus.
• Strong presenting and influencing skills with ability to turn data into a compelling story with actionable insight.
• Ability to extract data to devise management information reports required

Education & Experience
• Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience and completion of applicable professional designations. Typically a minimum five (5) years relevant professional experience.
• 2+ years' experience developing SQL queries and with relational database data manipulation required.
• 2+ experience pulling, manipulating, integrating, and managing data sets from various sources including contact center infrastructure models preferred.

#LI-CP1
#LI-Remote
CNA is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the recruitment process. To request an accommodation, please contact leaveadministration@cna.com

job_description:
Apex Systems is looking for a Operations Analyst for one of our largest multinational hospitality clients! This opportunity offers optional benefits, weekly pay, opportunity of extension and to convert to full time!

Job title: Operations Analyst...

Location: Hybrid 2-3 days in office

Must sit in:

Charlotte, Dallas, Phoenix, San Francisco, Des Moines

Type: contract

Contract length: 12+ months

Interview process: 1 virtual interview

Start date: ASAP-2 weeks or less after offer (middle of March)

Citizenship: USC or GC holder (no c2c for w2 purposes)

Screenings: Background once hired

Pay: starting at $35/hour
• +: benefits, full time position

Required Qualifications:
• Release implementation, Monitoring, alert, tech management
• Windows OS
• .Net
• SQL Server
• 3-5 years of experience
• Mongo 3+ years of Systems Engineering experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, or education.
• Using third party application that are needed to onboard and follow Wells Fargo regulations.
• Make sure they are ADA compliant when using SSO (Single Sign On) and making sure they have appropriate Identity and access management credentials and monitoring.
• Keep track of current 20 apps to make sure there are no vulnerabilities. Using 12 step process

Who you are/what you'll be doing:
• Employee must be able to execute strong customer service skills
• Participate in complex technical issues and initiatives related to large scale applications, systems, databases, or other technical products and services.
• Identify opportunity for process improvements within technical support strategies and plans. Review and analyze technical queries to extract data, create standard databases, or perform limited programming to fine tune systems supporting low to medium risk technical deliverables.
• Present recommendations for resolving complex technical queries.
• Exercise some independent judgment to analyze performance trends and recommend process improvements while developing understanding of technical process controls or standards.
• Work as an internal consultant regarding use of tools and processes.
• Provide information related to supported system area to functional colleagues, internal partners and stakeholders, including internal customers

job_description:
Softheon builds software and automation solutions for health insurers and government health agencies. Help shape the future of health tech while working from home with incredible benefits that reflect our commitment to expanding access to quality insurance. Work for a fast-growing, established, and profitable company where you can power what’s next in healthcare.

Position Summary...

We are seeking a detail-oriented Client Operations Analyst to join our team. This person will act as a liaison with customers to handle complaints, process orders, and provide information about the organization’s products and services.

This entry-level position involves interacting with customers over the phone, via email, and/or via social media. Throughout all these interactions, the Client Operations Analysts must maintain a high level of professionalism and present the organization in the best light possible.
Success in this position involves being able to resolve problems that customers may have but knowing when to refer advanced issues to members of the management team. If you are self-motivated and love talking with clients, this may be the role for you.

Key Responsibilities (include but not limited to):
• Maintain professional demeanor when speaking with clients or individual members.
• Process on the phone member payments.
• Act as first level support for member inquiries into their accounts and carrier inquiries into member specific or multiple member accounts.
• Ability to read and follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) while employing out of the box thinking to problem solving.
• Learn Softheon products to understand proper escalation channels based on ticket request.
• Assist in creating new and modifying existing documentation to ensure all processes are accurately documented.
• Work all required “manual” queues as assigned or needed.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's Degree or higher in Communications, Business Administration, or another related field of study.
• 0-2 years of work experience.
• Healthcare or service industry experience is a plus.
• Billing or Finance experience is a plus.
• Excel or SQL experience is a plus.
• Ability to create positive interactions with customers.
• Ability to work in an agile work environment and adapt to change.
• Excellent problem solving and organization skills.
• Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
• Passion to learn a new skillset and make a difference.

When you join Softheon, you will:
• Have an opportunity to add value to a diverse team of innovative professionals
• Rise to new challenges everyday
• Receive competitive salary and career growth opportunities

Softheon is an equal opportunities employer. We strongly believe that employing a diverse workforce is key to our success. We make recruitment hiring decisions based on each candidate's experience and skills. We value your passion to make healthcare affordable, accessible, and plentiful.

ABOUT US:

At Softheon we strive to create simple solutions to complex problems. Our innovative and easy-to-use products have revolutionized the way everyday people control their healthcare needs. Empowering the nation's first state health benefit exchange since 2008, Softheon's vision and strategic direction has designed five platforms to help our partners quickly adapt to industry standards, manage client data, and grow their membership, while never compromising the exceptional care they provide. In this highly dynamic industry, Softheon has maintained its position as a premier Business Process as a Service (BPaaS) and Software as a Service (SaaS) solution, utilized by 37% of healthcare payers and having been responsible for 12% of ACA enrollments processed. Our platform has been ranked #1 in addressing the industry’s ever-changing regulatory demands and recognized by Gartner, IDC, AHIP, ACAP, and HCEG.

To find out more about Softheon please visit www.softheon.com.

To all recruitment agencies: Softheon does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to Softheon employees or any other company location. Softheon is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with the Company

job_description:
Dutchie is looking for an ACH Operations Analyst to assist with the support of our newest payments product, Dutchie Pay. This individual will act as a subject matter expert on consumer and merchant ACH and reconciliation questions, including escalation and triage of issues. This role will also serve as backup support for our ACH operations department, which may include some reconciliation and... working closely with our bank partner(s). This is a quickly growing team, so we’re looking for someone who can collaborate cross-functionally and jump in as needed to manage multiple priorities.

What You'll Do...
• Reconcile funds transferred with banking partners daily, including originated and returned payments
• Assist as needed with monthly reconciliation
• Assist with resolving ACH returns and NOCs, including vendor tickets and investigations
• Provide Tier 2 support for incoming Dutchie Pay ACH questions from merchants and consumers
• Track losses from returns and retried payments and monitor for trends
• Monitor transactions for unusual or suspicious activity and provide input on fraud rules
• Monitor daily file export as needed
• Additional Payments team assistance as needed with cross-functional teams such as Fraud, Risk, and Support

What You Bring...
• 2+ years of back office recon and/or customer facing support for payments (ACH experience required; additional payments experience such as cards or wires a plus)
• Ability to coordinate with both internal and external stakeholders
• Detail oriented with excellent organizational skills
• Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing
• Strong sense of teamwork while working independently
• Operate independently with little supervision on a day-to-day basis

You’ll Get…
• Competitive Salary
• Equity
• 401(k)
• Full Benefits - Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
• Flexible vacation and sick days
• Technology (hardware, software, reading materials, etc..) allowance

At Dutchie, we’re committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Dutchie believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool

job_description:
Position Title: Data Analyst (Remote)

This opening is for a REMOTE position.

About InnovateEDU

InnovateEDU is a non-profit whose mission is to eliminate the opportunity gap by accelerating innovation in standards-aligned, next-generation learning models and tools that serve, inform, and enhance teaching and learning. InnovateEDU is committed to massively disrupting K-12 public education by focusing on the development of scalable tools and practices that leverage innovation, technology, and new human capital systems to improve education for all students and close the achievement gap.

About the Project

InnovateEDU strives to create real tooling and projects that greatly assist a school/district/state in moving toward embracing data standards, a data-driven culture, and data interoperability. Landing Zone, a project at InnovateEDU, aims to provide the best-in-class data infrastructure and support to client districts in order to transform how data is being used in the 20 (and... counting!) school systems where it is implemented. We believe supporting schools with data doesn’t just mean technology and dashboards - it means investing in the people who do the work. To that end when a school adopts Landing Zone, they get not only technical products but the ability to join a team of peers who are working and learning together as well as receive weekly coaching and support from the InnovateEDU Team.

Position:

InnovateEDU is seeking a full-time Data Analyst. This role is a little non-traditional in that its primary goal is to help the data teams that Landing Zone supports understand and make use of the Landing Zone data model. This role will be mentoring junior data analysts employed by school districts, so 2+ years experience as an analyst is a must.

The three main components of this role are the following:
• One-on-one and small group mentoring of school data analysts at school via weekly coaching sessions, check-ins, or our service desk.
• Creating and curating a set of exemplar data dashboards to expose school data to end users.
• Creating training materials and hosting webinars to build the skills of the school data analysts asynchronously or in larger groups
• Building a learning community among product users

This is a full-time position with the ability to work remotely. Landing Zone is a remote-first team and members are expected to be available during set hours in their US time zone.

Responsibilities:

Lead and manage a coaching cadence and support for client school districts.

Possible tasks include:
• Provide troubleshooting and advice for schools who need just in time support
• Provide weekly coaching and mentoring for data analysts at schools and districts throughout the country
• Create/ Revise workflow systems and procedures by monitoring and analyzing client usage, success, project tasks, and data to determine the need for implementation changes
• Provide administrative support as needed to maintain workflow
• Maintain and monitor implementation plans for schools
• Organize and participate in product meetings, especially communication around system upgrades or changes

Create dashboards and analyses on top of Landing Zone data.

Possible tasks include:
• Overhauling the base set of data dashboards that customers get when they join Landing Zone to have a consistent look and feel and use best practices for data visualization.
• Creating example SQL queries to calculate different metrics.
• Providing input on the Landing Zone data model to make it more usable for district analysts.

Curate/create a set of resources that analysts can work through independently to upskill themselves. Possible tasks include:
• Creating a scope and sequence of independent learning that we expect junior district analysts to complete.
• Finding the best online courses for learning/improving with SQL skills.
• Creating education-specific content targeted at building key skills sets
• Writing blog posts on new product features or tool capabilities.

Who You Are

You are a data maven. You have either been a data analyst yourself or worked in data for a school system. You are a natural coach. You are a mission-driven individual and believe in working to close the educational achievement gap. You are an optimistic problem-solver and believe that together we can create real solutions that help the entire sector move forward. You are keen to understand different moving pieces of a complex project and willing to use your skills to organize the work for seamless implementation. You are excited to join a growing team working on early-stage products that have long-term impacts on the sector.

You are open to feedback, bring your best every day, and are ready to grow in all areas of your work. You want to join a team of folks who share your vision for mission-driven work at the intersection of education and technology. Finally, you know that sharing often is key to this work and are ready to document everything that you do so that schools everywhere and the sector as a whole can benefit.

Experience and Skills

You are a good fit if you:
• Have 2+ years of experience in data analytics, data engineering, or a related field with a demonstrated history of project ownership and execution
• Are proficient in writing analytical SQL
• Have a strong desire to mentor other analysts to help them grow their skills
• Have experience using Google Data Studio or other BI tools
• Have an understanding of data warehouses and business intelligence tools
• Can communicate clearly and directly about complex technical topics
• Are highly motivated to work autonomously, with strong organizational and time management skills
• Experience with training/teaching technical concepts to enhance the skills of peers/others
• Experience in designing and carrying out logistics for events (e.g., workshops or symposia) for educator audiences (task analysis, materials, organizing calendars)
• Demonstrated ability in full-cycle project management from conception to delivery
• Experience with Python

You’ll have an edge if you:
• Have strong strong domain knowledge in K-12 education analytics
• Have experience building training or curriculum, especially for adult learners
• Have some experience with statistical software such as SAS, R, Python, SPSS, or other programs
• Have significant formal training in statistics and data visualization
• Have experience with training/teaching technical concepts to enhance the skills of peers/others
• Have experience in designing and carrying out logistics for events (e.g., workshops or symposia) for educator audiences (task analysis, materials, organizing calendars)

Required Qualifications:
• 2+ years of experience in data analytics, data engineering, or a related field with a demonstrated history of project ownership and execution
• 2+ years of SQL programming experience in SQL Server, Big Query, or related
• 2+ years of experience with data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio, Tableau, Power BI, or related
• Organized and detailed-oriented with the ability to troubleshoot and work independently.
• Demonstrated ability to take datasets and translate them and generate visualizations visualizations
• Willingness to work with district leaders and train them on building SQL queries, creating dashboards, and importing data into Big Query
• Excellent time management, organizational, prioritization, and problem-solving skills.
• Exceptional organizational and project management skills
• Experience in managing and successfully prioritizing competing priorities
• Ability to collaborate with staff and partners while accommodating multiple project demands and organizational priorities
• Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to foster collaborative and productive relationships among staff and external organizations and funders
• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills and the ability to listen and communicate clearly with a variety of audiences
• Strong attention to detail and ability to execute with limited supervision
• Working with internal systems such as JIRA, Asana, Slack to stay organized and ensure communication with team members
• Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office applications (e.g. Excel, Outlook) and GSuite (e.g., Drive, Docs, Sheets, Forms)
• Other duties as assigned

Our Stack
• Google Cloud Platform
• BigQuery
• Python
• DBT (soon!)
• Google Data Studio

What to expect in the hiring process
• Initial phone screen with a member of the Landing Zone team (30 minute Zoom call)
• A project that will take about 3 hours. The basic gist of this project is to write a SQL query and develop a data visualization in Google Data Studio.
• A project review with a technical member of the Landing Zone team (30 minute Zoom call)
• A final round interview with the head of Landing Zone and other leadership team members from the organization.

Salary and benefits will be commensurate with experience. The range for this position starts at $65,000.

Application Instructions
• Relocation support is not available for this position.
• Applications without both a resume and cover letter will not be considered
