job_description:
Position Title: Data Analyst (Remote)

This opening is for a REMOTE position.

About InnovateEDU

InnovateEDU is a non-profit whose mission is to eliminate the opportunity gap by accelerating innovation in standards-aligned, next-generation learning models and tools that serve, inform, and enhance teaching and learning. InnovateEDU is committed to massively disrupting K-12 public education by focusing on the development of scalable tools and practices that leverage innovation, technology, and new human capital systems to improve education for all students and close the achievement gap.

About the Project

InnovateEDU strives to create real tooling and projects that greatly assist a school/district/state in moving toward embracing data standards, a data-driven culture, and data interoperability. Landing Zone, a project at InnovateEDU, aims to provide the best-in-class data infrastructure and support to client districts in order to transform how data is being used in the 20 (and... counting!) school systems where it is implemented. We believe supporting schools with data doesn’t just mean technology and dashboards - it means investing in the people who do the work. To that end when a school adopts Landing Zone, they get not only technical products but the ability to join a team of peers who are working and learning together as well as receive weekly coaching and support from the InnovateEDU Team.

Position:

InnovateEDU is seeking a full-time Data Analyst. This role is a little non-traditional in that its primary goal is to help the data teams that Landing Zone supports understand and make use of the Landing Zone data model. This role will be mentoring junior data analysts employed by school districts, so 2+ years experience as an analyst is a must.

The three main components of this role are the following:
• One-on-one and small group mentoring of school data analysts at school via weekly coaching sessions, check-ins, or our service desk.
• Creating and curating a set of exemplar data dashboards to expose school data to end users.
• Creating training materials and hosting webinars to build the skills of the school data analysts asynchronously or in larger groups
• Building a learning community among product users

This is a full-time position with the ability to work remotely. Landing Zone is a remote-first team and members are expected to be available during set hours in their US time zone.

Responsibilities:

Lead and manage a coaching cadence and support for client school districts.

Possible tasks include:
• Provide troubleshooting and advice for schools who need just in time support
• Provide weekly coaching and mentoring for data analysts at schools and districts throughout the country
• Create/ Revise workflow systems and procedures by monitoring and analyzing client usage, success, project tasks, and data to determine the need for implementation changes
• Provide administrative support as needed to maintain workflow
• Maintain and monitor implementation plans for schools
• Organize and participate in product meetings, especially communication around system upgrades or changes

Create dashboards and analyses on top of Landing Zone data.

Possible tasks include:
• Overhauling the base set of data dashboards that customers get when they join Landing Zone to have a consistent look and feel and use best practices for data visualization.
• Creating example SQL queries to calculate different metrics.
• Providing input on the Landing Zone data model to make it more usable for district analysts.

Curate/create a set of resources that analysts can work through independently to upskill themselves. Possible tasks include:
• Creating a scope and sequence of independent learning that we expect junior district analysts to complete.
• Finding the best online courses for learning/improving with SQL skills.
• Creating education-specific content targeted at building key skills sets
• Writing blog posts on new product features or tool capabilities.

Who You Are

You are a data maven. You have either been a data analyst yourself or worked in data for a school system. You are a natural coach. You are a mission-driven individual and believe in working to close the educational achievement gap. You are an optimistic problem-solver and believe that together we can create real solutions that help the entire sector move forward. You are keen to understand different moving pieces of a complex project and willing to use your skills to organize the work for seamless implementation. You are excited to join a growing team working on early-stage products that have long-term impacts on the sector.

You are open to feedback, bring your best every day, and are ready to grow in all areas of your work. You want to join a team of folks who share your vision for mission-driven work at the intersection of education and technology. Finally, you know that sharing often is key to this work and are ready to document everything that you do so that schools everywhere and the sector as a whole can benefit.

Experience and Skills

You are a good fit if you:
• Have 2+ years of experience in data analytics, data engineering, or a related field with a demonstrated history of project ownership and execution
• Are proficient in writing analytical SQL
• Have a strong desire to mentor other analysts to help them grow their skills
• Have experience using Google Data Studio or other BI tools
• Have an understanding of data warehouses and business intelligence tools
• Can communicate clearly and directly about complex technical topics
• Are highly motivated to work autonomously, with strong organizational and time management skills
• Experience with training/teaching technical concepts to enhance the skills of peers/others
• Experience in designing and carrying out logistics for events (e.g., workshops or symposia) for educator audiences (task analysis, materials, organizing calendars)
• Demonstrated ability in full-cycle project management from conception to delivery
• Experience with Python

You’ll have an edge if you:
• Have strong strong domain knowledge in K-12 education analytics
• Have experience building training or curriculum, especially for adult learners
• Have some experience with statistical software such as SAS, R, Python, SPSS, or other programs
• Have significant formal training in statistics and data visualization
• Have experience with training/teaching technical concepts to enhance the skills of peers/others
• Have experience in designing and carrying out logistics for events (e.g., workshops or symposia) for educator audiences (task analysis, materials, organizing calendars)

Required Qualifications:
• 2+ years of experience in data analytics, data engineering, or a related field with a demonstrated history of project ownership and execution
• 2+ years of SQL programming experience in SQL Server, Big Query, or related
• 2+ years of experience with data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio, Tableau, Power BI, or related
• Organized and detailed-oriented with the ability to troubleshoot and work independently.
• Demonstrated ability to take datasets and translate them and generate visualizations visualizations
• Willingness to work with district leaders and train them on building SQL queries, creating dashboards, and importing data into Big Query
• Excellent time management, organizational, prioritization, and problem-solving skills.
• Exceptional organizational and project management skills
• Experience in managing and successfully prioritizing competing priorities
• Ability to collaborate with staff and partners while accommodating multiple project demands and organizational priorities
• Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to foster collaborative and productive relationships among staff and external organizations and funders
• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills and the ability to listen and communicate clearly with a variety of audiences
• Strong attention to detail and ability to execute with limited supervision
• Working with internal systems such as JIRA, Asana, Slack to stay organized and ensure communication with team members
• Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office applications (e.g. Excel, Outlook) and GSuite (e.g., Drive, Docs, Sheets, Forms)
• Other duties as assigned

Our Stack
• Google Cloud Platform
• BigQuery
• Python
• DBT (soon!)
• Google Data Studio

What to expect in the hiring process
• Initial phone screen with a member of the Landing Zone team (30 minute Zoom call)
• A project that will take about 3 hours. The basic gist of this project is to write a SQL query and develop a data visualization in Google Data Studio.
• A project review with a technical member of the Landing Zone team (30 minute Zoom call)
• A final round interview with the head of Landing Zone and other leadership team members from the organization.

Salary and benefits will be commensurate with experience. The range for this position starts at $65,000.

Application Instructions
• Relocation support is not available for this position.
• Applications without both a resume and cover letter will not be considered

job_description:
Job Summary/Company:

Sparks Group in collaboration with a government contracting company is searching for a qualified and proactive Operations Analyst. The ideal candidate will have experience in a government contracting environment. They will be responsible for processing subcontracts and related documents to prepare them for review. If you’re looking for a new opportunity to grow your career... apply now!

Responsibilities:
• Manage multiple procurement activities, assess risk, and develop plans in all the phases of procurement process
• Assess and identify needs, determine requirements, and develop purchasing plans
• Prepare and route documents for review and approval
• Analyzes data and converts findings to actionable recommendations for solutions
• Monitor vendor evaluation progress regularly to report project status to procurement management and internal customers
• Understand business objectives to generate project information, action items, schedule, and deliverables for the team
• Assist team in ad-hoc procurement and sourcing projects as needed

Qualifications/Background Profile:
• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, or related field required
• 2+ years as Contracts/Procurement Coordinator/Specialist level experience
• Proficient Excel skills including pivot table, Business Intelligence systems such as PowerBI, Contract Management Experience.
• Skilled with tools such as MS Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint
• Strong relationship building skills
• Solid analytical skills to interpret complex reports, needs and documentations
• Good communication skills with the ability to communicate with teams or present recommendations to increase the efficiency of the processes

This job is Remote Flexible.

-----------------------------------

Download the Sparks Group mobile app from Apple App Store or Google Play.

-----------------------------------

Qualified candidates should send their resume AND call Sparks Group for additional details. Please note, resume must include a valid email address in order to be considered. We look forward to discussing your background, your current job search, and your potential career path with Sparks Group!

Sparks Group is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, pregnancy, citizenship, family status, genetic information, disability, or protect veteran status

job_description:
The Position
Do you dream about creating a more sustainable future? At Uplight, we are motivating energy users and providers to accelerate the clean energy ecosystem. Working with over 75 of the world's leading electric and gas utilities, Uplight provides an end-to-end customer energy experience. Uplight delivers personalized experiences that customers have now come to expect-improving... satisfaction, increasing revenue, reducing the cost to serve, and contributing to carbon reduction goals. We are in the process of obtaining our B Corp certification, enabling us to put our values into action by not only making decisions for the benefit of our shareholders, but also for our customers, environment, employees, and community.
We are seeking a Sales Operations Analyst to join our team and help us achieve our ambitious goals for our business and for the planet.
What you will contribute:
You will be an integral member of our Sales Operations & Enablement team, partnering with Sales , Marketing, Customer Success, Finance, and supporting teams to determine strategy, implement performance metrics, and influence the alignment of all sales operations . The right candidate will quickly become a trusted operating partner and support to the Leadership team, and will ensure successful delivery of Sales planning, forecasting, pipeline management, account assignments & process optimization. This role will report to the VP Sales Operations & Enablement, and drive sales effectiveness by establishing measurable processes to improve sales efficiency, lead generation optimization, and determine growth goals. This Sales Operations Analyst will drive performance, produce actionable reporting and analysis, and build enablement programs to partner with cross functional leadership to influence decision-making and results.
What you get to do:
• Define, build, maintain, and improve our data, analytics, and reporting foundation and provide visibility and performance tracking to the business
• Assist with all analyses, strategies, and deliverables
• Drive continuous improvement through standard operating cadences, including weekly metric reviews in addition to monthly and quarterly business reviews
• Define/deploy new operational processes and ensure rigorous adoption across the S&SP organization (pipeline hygiene, account ownership, etc.)
• Collaborate with Sales , Finance, Marketing, and other cross-functional stakeholders to design and execute strategic and/or operational projects to increase sales productivity, operational efficiency, and revenue including training
• Evaluate, improve, and manage key salesops processes and tools like SFDC, Highspot, CPQ etc.

What you bring to Uplight:
• 2+ years prior experience in sales operations for a high growth company, or operational experience in management consulting, SaaS, enterprise software/technology, or business insights / analytics roles.
• Reporting and Record Management from lead creation through opportunity closure.
• Proven ability to lead and scale Sales/Revenue Operations of significant scope through growth periods.
• Fluency with core operating metrics, including ROI, Conversion Ratios, and other Efficiency metrics.
• Demonstrated experience as a Saleforce.com Administrator, CPQ administrator with technical implementation & operations experience.
• Skilled in Salesforce platform with the ability to converge system capabilities with an optimal internal process to deliver end-to-end data intelligence needed to meet targets and drive growth.
• Superior organizational and analytical skills
• Ability to independently identify problems, propose solutions and execute those solutions
• A positive, energetic, responsive, and helpful attitude, while also being direct, concise, and pragmatic.
• Strong prioritization skills
• Demonstrated ability to scale and equip the business in a strategic manner, communicate big picture opportunities and make data-driven decisions.
• An enthusiastic "roll up your sleeves" mentality that can thrive under pressure.
• Advanced spreadsheet skills and are quick to learn and adopt new sales technology.
• Proficiency in Salesforce.com, CPQ platforms, Highspot, Pardot, etc. with expertise in leading Salesforce improvement efforts
Bonus Points:
• Experience in Salesforce.com, CPQ & CLM platforms, Highspot, Pardot, Gainsight, Mavenlink, etc.

Skills and experience are necessary, but we hire on value alignment first, so if you feel you would be a good fit with us, still consider applying.
What makes working at Uplight amazing:
In addition to all the standard medical and dental benefits, that kick in Day 1, we are:
• Proud to be over 500+ purpose-driven individuals helping to create a more sustainable planet.
• Committed to the environment, our employees, and our communities.
• Focused on career growth by following defined career ladders.
• Committed to taking our work and mission seriously and....we love to laugh!

We also provide:
• 401k Match
• 401k Match
• Medical, vision, and dental insurance
• Monthly wellness stipend
• Peer to peer recognition program
• Management by objectives bonus plan
• Innovative flexible time off policy
• Exceptionally collaborative and cool office spaces (once we reopen them)

Salary Range: $67,000 to $88,000 USD
In accordance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the approximate annual base compensation range is listed above. The actual offer, reflecting the total compensation package and benefits, will be determined by a number of factors including the applicant's experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity among our team.
Uplight provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race (including hair texture and hairstyles), color, religion (including head coverings), age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws

job_description:
The Position
Do you dream about creating a more sustainable future? At Uplight, we are motivating energy users and providers to accelerate the clean energy ecosystem. Working with over 75 of the world's leading electric and gas utilities, Uplight provides an end-to-end customer energy experience. Uplight delivers personalized experiences that customers have now come to expect-improving... satisfaction, increasing revenue, reducing the cost to serve, and contributing to carbon reduction goals. We are in the process of obtaining our B Corp certification, enabling us to put our values into action by not only making decisions for the benefit of our shareholders, but also for our customers, environment, employees, and community.
We are seeking a Sales Operations Analyst to join our team and help us achieve our ambitious goals for our business and for the planet.
What you will contribute:
You will be an integral member of our Sales Operations & Enablement team, partnering with Sales , Marketing, Customer Success, Finance, and supporting teams to determine strategy, implement performance metrics, and influence the alignment of all sales operations . The right candidate will quickly become a trusted operating partner and support to the Leadership team, and will ensure successful delivery of Sales planning, forecasting, pipeline management, account assignments & process optimization. This role will report to the VP Sales Operations & Enablement, and drive sales effectiveness by establishing measurable processes to improve sales efficiency, lead generation optimization, and determine growth goals. This Sales Operations Analyst will drive performance, produce actionable reporting and analysis, and build enablement programs to partner with cross functional leadership to influence decision-making and results.
What you get to do:
• Define, build, maintain, and improve our data, analytics, and reporting foundation and provide visibility and performance tracking to the business
• Assist with all analyses, strategies, and deliverables
• Drive continuous improvement through standard operating cadences, including weekly metric reviews in addition to monthly and quarterly business reviews
• Define/deploy new operational processes and ensure rigorous adoption across the S&SP organization (pipeline hygiene, account ownership, etc.)
• Collaborate with Sales , Finance, Marketing, and other cross-functional stakeholders to design and execute strategic and/or operational projects to increase sales productivity, operational efficiency, and revenue including training
• Evaluate, improve, and manage key salesops processes and tools like SFDC, Highspot, CPQ etc.

What you bring to Uplight:
• 2+ years prior experience in sales operations for a high growth company, or operational experience in management consulting, SaaS, enterprise software/technology, or business insights / analytics roles.
• Reporting and Record Management from lead creation through opportunity closure.
• Proven ability to lead and scale Sales/Revenue Operations of significant scope through growth periods.
• Fluency with core operating metrics, including ROI, Conversion Ratios, and other Efficiency metrics.
• Demonstrated experience as a Saleforce.com Administrator, CPQ administrator with technical implementation & operations experience.
• Skilled in Salesforce platform with the ability to converge system capabilities with an optimal internal process to deliver end-to-end data intelligence needed to meet targets and drive growth.
• Superior organizational and analytical skills
• Ability to independently identify problems, propose solutions and execute those solutions
• A positive, energetic, responsive, and helpful attitude, while also being direct, concise, and pragmatic.
• Strong prioritization skills
• Demonstrated ability to scale and equip the business in a strategic manner, communicate big picture opportunities and make data-driven decisions.
• An enthusiastic "roll up your sleeves" mentality that can thrive under pressure.
• Advanced spreadsheet skills and are quick to learn and adopt new sales technology.
• Proficiency in Salesforce.com, CPQ platforms, Highspot, Pardot, etc. with expertise in leading Salesforce improvement efforts
Bonus Points:
• Experience in Salesforce.com, CPQ & CLM platforms, Highspot, Pardot, Gainsight, Mavenlink, etc.

Skills and experience are necessary, but we hire on value alignment first, so if you feel you would be a good fit with us, still consider applying.
What makes working at Uplight amazing:
In addition to all the standard medical and dental benefits, that kick in Day 1, we are:
• Proud to be over 500+ purpose-driven individuals helping to create a more sustainable planet.
• Committed to the environment, our employees, and our communities.
• Focused on career growth by following defined career ladders.
• Committed to taking our work and mission seriously and....we love to laugh!

We also provide:
• 401k Match
• 401k Match
• Medical, vision, and dental insurance
• Monthly wellness stipend
• Peer to peer recognition program
• Management by objectives bonus plan
• Innovative flexible time off policy
• Exceptionally collaborative and cool office spaces (once we reopen them)

Salary Range: $67,000 to $88,000 USD
In accordance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the approximate annual base compensation range is listed above. The actual offer, reflecting the total compensation package and benefits, will be determined by a number of factors including the applicant's experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity among our team.
Uplight provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race (including hair texture and hairstyles), color, religion (including head coverings), age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws

job_description:
Company Summary Statement
As one of the largest investor-owned utility companies in the United States, PPL Corporation (NYSE: PPL), is committed to creating long-term, sustainable value for our 3.5 million customers, our shareowners and the communities we serve. Our high-performing regulated utilities — PPL Electric Utilities, Louisville Gas and Electric, Kentucky Utilities and Rhode Island... Energy — provide an outstanding experience for our customers, consistently ranking among the best utilities in the nation. PPL’s companies are also addressing challenges head-on by investing in new infrastructure and technology that is creating a smarter, more reliable and resilient energy grid. We are committed to doing our part to advance a cleaner energy future and drive innovation that enables us to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 while maintaining energy reliability and affordability for the customers and communities we serve. PPL is a positive force in the cities and towns where we do business, providing support for programs and organizations that empower the success of future generations by helping to build and maintain strong, diverse communities today.
Overview

The purpose of the HR Operations Analyst is to provide HR with analytical, functional, compliance, and business process expertise for HR and its customers. This position plays a lead role in maintaining and enhancing HR processes and consults with customers to drive solutions and within the HR landscape. The HR Operations Analyst supports and maintains HR applications, structure, processes and procedures to deliver programs to Corporate HR and our business segments. In this role, the analyst supports functional testing of HR system changes, troubleshooting, approving HR security requests and functional helpdesk support.

Responsibilities
• Promotes and supports new or improved business processes by participating in strategic planning and driving solutions and assisting in implementation of HR applications and processes.
• Manages HR security for access to HR information and reports.
• Understands critical business needs and problems of the business. Advocates business solutions and/or initiatives that will move the business closer to achieving its vision, mission, and strategic goals.
• Develops individual or group training sessions for end users regarding functionality and proper usage of HR software as well as the supporting procedures and business process documentation.
• Maintains an awareness of business process and technology trends and changes. Promotes and supports solutions that will add value and contribute to the success of PPL.
• Provides diagnosis, analysis, and resolution of business problems. Develops alternative approaches to solving problems and meeting customer needs.
• Leads the functional analysis, testing, and migration of new or upgraded products and technologies.
• Provides in-depth technical expertise and support, including production support, for various HR functional areas (e.g. Recruiting, Compensation, Talent Management, Payroll, Security, Benefits, etc.).
• May directly or indirectly supervise a small group of individual contributors.
• Manages HR projects for successful delivery coordinating HR staff and resources outside of HR as required to deliver changes.
• May be assigned a storm role for the utility. This is a special assignment that comes into play during storms and other emergencies when the company needs to restore power or respond to other issues affecting customer service. This role may necessitate the need to work after-hours, outside of your normal schedule.
• The company reserves the right to determine if this position will be assigned to work on-site, remotely, or a combination of both. Assigned work location may change. In the case of remote work, physical presence in the office/on-site may be required to engage in face-to-face interaction and coordination of work among direct reports and co-workers.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree, or equivalent experience, in analytics, informatics, computer science, programming, HRIS, or business applications.
• 2 years of experience in an operational function supporting HR business analysis and process design.
• Experience with PeopleSoft HCM, Oracle HCM or similar HR enterprise application suite

Preferred Qualifications
• Project management experience.
• Professional Certification in a technical or business area.
• Understanding of compliance and regulatory requirements.
• Knowledge of various reporting tools such as: PeopleSoft Query, MicroStrategy, Microsoft Office Suite, SQL language.
• PpSe

job_description:
Headway is building a new mental healthcare system that everyone can access. We make it easy for people to find quality in-network mental health care by removing historic barriers faced by mental health providers, payers, and patients.

1 in 4 people in the US have a treatable mental health condition, but the vast majority do not get the care they need. The primary reason is cost: the majority of therapists do not accept insurance, meaning paying for therapy is prohibitively expensive for prospective patients. This is where we got our start – Headway has built the first software-enabled network of therapists who accept health insurance, making it easy for therapists to grow their practices, and possible for patients to find quality care they can afford.

We launched in April of 2019 and are now powering 300,000+ appointments per month. To scale our vision, we’ve raised over $100 million in funding from a16z, Thrive, Accel, and Google Ventures.

Join us, and make an impact

About The... Role

As a member of the Network Operations team, you will play an integral role in helping our network of therapists accept insurance and begin offering sessions to clients. In this role, you will manage the credentialing process from start to finish, monitor our pipeline health, and support the overall maintenance of our network to ensure we have quality providers and clean provider data.

You will face ambiguous problems and be responsible for advancing our pipeline of therapists throughout various stages in the therapist life cycle at Headway. You will work cross-functionally with the sales, customer experience, and engineering teams to make progress within our systems. You’ll also work closely with our providers and insurance partners.

You’d be a great fit if...
• You have 1+ years experience in operations
• You have experience managing and driving projects forward independently. You’re process driven, extremely detail oriented and highly organized.
• You’re highly adaptable. You can quickly change direction to execute different functions and responsibilities with ease.
• You enjoy challenges and tackle them thoughtfully and analytically.
• You want to learn and grow. You view this role as an opportunity to learn from a talented team and are excited to take on more responsibility at Headway over time.
• You’re an excellent communicator.
• You are passionate about increasing access to mental health.

We believe a team's strength is in its people, and we cannot achieve this mission without a team that reflects the diversity of this problem - across race, ethnicity, gender, sexuality, age, national origin, religion, family status, disability, military status, and experience.

Headway employees work remotely across the US, with the option to work from our NYC HQ.

Headway is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Headway will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact talent@findheadway.com

You view this role as an opportunity to learn from a talented team and are excited to take on more responsibility at Headway over time. • You’re an excellent communicator.

• You want to learn and grow. You view this role as an opportunity to learn from a talented team and are excited to take on more responsibility at Headway over time.
• You’re an excellent communicator.
• You are passionate about increasing access to mental health.

We believe a team's strength is in its people, and we cannot achieve this mission without a team that reflects the diversity of this problem - across race, ethnicity, gender, sexuality, age, national origin, religion, family status, disability, military status, and experience.

Headway employees work remotely across the US, with the option to work from our NYC HQ.

Headway is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Headway will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact talent@findheadway.com
job_description_summary: 1 in 4 people in the US have a treatable mental health condition, but the vast majority do not get the care they need. This is where we got our start – Headway has built the first software-enabled network of therapists who accept health insurance, making it easy for therapists to grow their practices, and possible for patients to find quality care they can afford. In this role, you will manage the credentialing process from start to finish, monitor our pipeline health, and support the overall maintenance of our network to ensure we have quality providers and clean provider data. You view this role as an opportunity to learn from a talented team and are excited to take on more responsibility at Headway over time. • You’re an excellent communicator.

job_description:
+SUBSCRIBE® is an enterprise software solution providing electronic subscription document technology and an order management system for alternative product transactions.

Our technology allows allocators, sponsors, and service providers to digitize the entire onboarding, investment, and reporting process for alternative investments. Through our open-architecture platform, all stakeholders are... easily connected to a central venue allowing for collaboration that reduces errors, saving time and money.

Our mission is to give our clients control and reduce friction for a very painful investment process through the use of our platform.

Responsibilities:
• Prepare Subscription Documents for digitization in the platform
• Support existing clients with Fund and Offering updates
• Drive successful client outcomes by assisting clients throughout the transaction process (including subscriptions, transfers, and redemptions) and managing fund closings
• Build and nurture relationships with new and existing fund managers and clients
• Liaise with clients on user experience of the platform; partner with the technology team to enhance client experience
• Develop new processes to further automate client workflows and create a seamless experience
• Work cross functionally with various teams including Sales, Client Support and Technology teams to appropriately respond to inbound requests and questions
• Additional responsibilities will be determined based on capacity, skill, and interest

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in economics, finance, or a related discipline
• Strong client service orientation with the ability to manage multiple competing priorities
• Advanced MS Excel, PowerPoint, Adobe, general technological literacy (coding knowledge not necessary)
• Ability to work in a very fast paced environment
• Exemplary oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills

job_description:
What We Do:

Marketing Operations is a critical role that prioritizes the lead lifecycle, manages day-to-day marketing initiatives, oversees the organization’s MarTech stack, and enables the business with marketing performance insights...

What You’ll Do:

The role will be responsible for guiding, developing, and managing methodology and key performance indicators for marketing operations including email performance and campaign performance. The role will gather and examine reports and data and translate into best practices and enablement strategies for other marketing functions to fine-tune our marketing revenue engine. This role is a critical member of the Marketing team and holds responsibility for driving operational excellence, including performance tracking, lead funnel management, and measurement, database health, and reporting and campaign production process.
• Measure, evaluate, and report on the impact of marketing campaigns to the marketing team
• Provide insights to help the team optimize campaign strategies
• Report on email performance and email marketing excellence
• Investigate roadblocks with lead flow from a systems and business process standpoint
• Participate in strategic projects to help inform growth planning and operationalize select key initiatives

Who You Are:
• 2+ years experience working in operations, analytics, or a similar role preferred
• Skilled in Marketo, Salesforce, Excel, Bizible/Marketo Measure preferred
• Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and optimization mindset
• Ability to escalate and communicate risks to management and relevant stakeholders
• Demonstrated ability to translate business and platform requirements into marketing campaigns/MarTech knowledge
• Experience with database hygiene and excellence such as segmentation and measurements
• Maintain a learning mindset and the ability to understand concepts and systems
• Strong communication skills and experience working in cross-functional teams
• Self-starter and excellent in self-management, experience in working with remote teams
• Excellent communicator and cross-functional partner
• Highly data-directed
• You’re empathetic and work to understand your audience
• Creative and experimental. You love problem-solving, navigating ambiguity, and running experiments to test and validate new ideas
• Excited about Calm’s mission and passionate about mental health and wellness
The anticipated salary range for this position is $102,300 - $143,200. The base salary range represents the low and high end of Calm’s salary range for this position. Not all candidates will be eligible for the upper end of the salary range. Exact salary will ultimately depend on multiple factors, which may include the successful candidates skills, experience and other qualifications. This role is also eligible for equity + comprehensive benefits + 401k + flexible time off.

Calm focuses on Mobile, Personal Health, Apps, Health and Wellness, and Leisure. Their company has offices in San Francisco. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees. To date, Calm has raised $115.993M of funding; their latest round was closed on February 2019 at a valuation of $1B.

You can view their website at http://www.calm.com or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn
job_description_summary: The role will be responsible for guiding, developing, and managing methodology and key performance indicators for marketing operations including email performance and campaign performance. • Measure, evaluate, and report on the impact of marketing campaigns to the marketing team • Provide insights to help the team optimize campaign strategies • Report on email performance and email marketing excellence • Investigate roadblocks with lead flow from a systems and business process standpoint • Participate in strategic projects to help inform growth planning and operationalize select key initiatives You love problem-solving, navigating ambiguity, and running experiments to test and validate new ideas • Excited about Calm’s mission and passionate about mental health and wellness The anticipated salary range for this position is $102,300 - $143,200. Not all candidates will be eligible for the upper end of the salary range. To date, Calm has raised $115.993M of funding; their latest round was closed on February 2019 at a valuation of $1B.

job_description:
ABOUT RIGHTWAY

Rightway is on a mission to harmonize healthcare for everyone, everywhere. Our products guide patients to the best care and medications by inserting clinicians and pharmacists into a patient’s care journey through a modern, mobile app. Rightway is a front door to healthcare, giving patients the tools they need along with on-demand access to Rightway health guides, human experts... that answer their questions and manage the frustrating parts of healthcare for them.

Since its founding in 2017, Rightway has raised over $130mm from investors including Khosla Ventures, Thrive Capital, and Tiger Global at a valuation of $1 billion. We’re headquartered in New York City, with satellite offices in Miami and Denver. Our clients rely on us to transform the healthcare experience, improve outcomes for their teams, and decrease their healthcare costs.

ABOUT THE ROLE

Our pharmacy benefit management (PBM) offering represents an important growth area for Rightway. Helping clients better manage pharmacy spend to make drugs more affordable for their employees and dependents is critical to their business sustainability. Rightway is responsible for designing, building, and operating a new-to-the-world PBM model base on our core tenets: fairness & transparency, unlocking the supply chain, supporting the physician-patient relationship, and utilizing navigation to empower consumers

The PBM Operations Analyst is a member of the Rightway Operations team reporting to the Director, Claims & Data Operations. This role will be responsible for the configuration, testing and maintenance of benefits, and related claims adjudication rules within the claim platform along with ongoing management of data operations.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Support the execution of all eligibility and accumulator operations and interfaces from implementation through ongoing operations and maintenance.
• Serve as day-to-day contact for all eligibility and accumulator needs.
• Collaborates with technology, account management, benefit administration, and other internal stakeholders to ensure that eligibility and accumulator functions are implemented and operating in accordance with requirements.
• Oversee all downstream vendor feeds (i.e. ID card fulfillment), third party integrations (i.e. health plans, TPAs) and ensures all deliverables are met timely and troubleshoots issues.
• Configures benefits into the claim adjudication platform, including benefit inclusions/exclusions copay, accumulator, and other benefit parameters.
• Develops and executes on test scenarios to ensure accuracy of benefit setup both at initial setup and conducts ongoing monitoring and regression testing. Works to correct all identified defects.
• Performs research and troubleshoots inquiries or issues related to claims adjudication, accumulators, and eligibility.
• Ensures all documentation regarding setup and internal controls is always up to date.

REQUIREMENTS
• Education Level: Bachelor’s degree preferred. Relevant experience considered for exceptional candidates.
• Pharmacy Technician or related experience highly desirable
• Work experience: 1-3 years of PBM experience in claims or benefit configuration
• Location information: NYC or Denver, highly qualified remote candidates will be considered
• Important characteristics of ideal candidate: Detail-oriented, intellectually curious, ability to challenge the status quo, consultative with internal and external clients, ability to think critically and problem solve, ability to work in a fast-paced environment with shifting priorities.
• Specific skills needed for job: Extensive knowledge of pharmacy benefit configuration and claims processing. Working knowledge of Medispan.

SALARY RANGE :
• $80,000-$100,000

HOW WE LIVE OUR VALUES TO OUR TEAMMATES:

We’re seeking those with passion for healthcare and relentless devotion to our goal. We need team members that embody our following core values:

1) We are human, first
Our humanity binds us together. We bring the same empathetic approach to every individual we engage with, whether it be our members, our clients, or each other. We are all worthy of respect and understanding and we engage in our interactions with care and intention. We honor our stories. We listen to—and hear—each other, we celebrate our differences and similarities, we are present for each other, and we strive for mutual understanding.

2) We redefine what is possible
We always look beyond the obstacles in front of us to imagine new solutions. We approach our work with inspiration from other industries, other leaders, and other challenges. We use ingenuity and resourcefulness when faced with tough problems.

3) We debate then commit
We believe that a spirit of open discourse is part of a healthy culture. We understand and appreciate different perspectives and we challenge our assumptions. When working toward a decision or a new solution, we actively listen to one another, approach it with a “yes, and” mentality, and assume positive intent. Once a decision is made, we align and champion it as one team.

4) We cultivate grit
Changing healthcare doesn’t happen overnight. We reflect and learn from challenges and approach the future with a determination to strive for better. In the face of daunting situations, we value persistence. We embrace failure as a stepping stone to future success. On this journey, we seek to act with guts, resilience, initiative, and tenacity.

5) We seek to delight
Healthcare is complicated and personal. We work tirelessly to meet the goals of our clients while also delivering the best experience to our members. We recognize that no matter the role or team, we each play a crucial part in our members’ care and take that responsibility seriously. When faced with an obstacle, we are kind, respectful, and solution-oriented in our approach. We hold ourselves accountable to our clients and our members’ success.

Rightway is a healthcare company looking to improve healthcare outcomes for everyone, everywhere. With that in mind, we have to consider what is good for the health of our team, the company, and the communities we operate in. As such, Rightway has determined a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy for all employees, in combination with other safety precautions, is the best way forward.

Rightway is PROUDLY an Equal Opportunity Employer that believes in strength in the diversity of thought processes, beliefs, background and education and fosters an inclusive culture where differences are celebrated to drive the best business decisions possible. We do not discriminate on any basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the consideration of merit, qualifications, need and performance

job_description:
Alma is on a mission to simplify access to high-quality, affordable mental health care. We do this by making it easy and financially rewarding for therapists to accept insurance and offer in-network care. When a provider joins Alma, they gain access to a suite of tools that not only help them better run their business, but also grow it sustainably and develop as a provider. Alma is available in... all 50 states, with over 11,000 therapists in our growing network. Anyone looking for a therapist can browse Alma’s free directory. Alma has raised $220.5M in funding from Insight Partners, Optum Ventures, Tusk Venture Partners, Primary Venture Partners, Sound Ventures, BoxGroup, Cigna Ventures, and Rainfall Ventures. Alma was also named one of Inc’s Best Workplaces in 2022.
Website
Job BoardValuesCandidate Interview Guide

Senior Security Operations Analyst

Alma is seeking a mission-driven Senior Security Operations Analyst to join our team. We are dedicated to building and operating secure and compliant tools and services which help providers more easily manage and grow their practice. In this role, you will help us defend against cybersecurity incidents by identifying, analyzing, communicating and containing incidents as they occur.

The ideal person for this role loves to research tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs) leveraged by attackers and adversaries and work with other teams to define standards, procedures and automated processes to uncover, resist and recover from security incidents.

What you’ll do:
• Defend against cybersecurity incidents and identifies, analyzes, communicates and contains incidents as they occur.
• Conduct network monitoring, intrusion detection analysis, log-based and endpoint-based threat detection to detect and protect against threats coming from multiple sources
• Deploy cloud-centric detection to detect threats related to cloud environments and services used by the organization
• Work with security information and event management (SIEM) to correlate activity across assets (endpoint, network, apps) and environments (on-premises, cloud) and identify patterns of anomalous activity
• Researche emerging threats and vulnerabilities to aid in the identification of incidents
• Create runbooks for frequently occurring incidents to automate or at least assist with the resolution of those cases
• Provide users with incident response support, including mitigating actions to contain activity and facilitating forensics analysis when necessary
• Validate and maintain incident response plans and processes to address potential threats

Who you are:
• You have 4+ years of experience working in a similar role with web technologies and information security.
• Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) and/or Global Information Assurance Certification (GIAC)
• You strongly understand AWS security , with an ability to build automated processes that can scale
• You have experience monitoring security systems that can scale, with high levels of automation.
• Experience deploying and tuning a security information and event management (SIEM) platform
• Knowledge of tactics, techniques and procedures leveraged by attackers and adversaries (e.g., MITRE ATT&CK)
• Strong decision-making capabilities, with a proven ability to weigh the relative costs and benefits of potential actions and identify the most appropriate one
• You have strong communication skills and can convey complex technical topics to non-technical stakeholders clearly and concisely.

Benefits:
• We’re a remote-first company
• Health insurance plans through Cigna (medical and dental) and MetLife (vision), including FSA & HSA plans
• 401k plan (Roth and traditional)
• Free Alma platform access
• Monthly therapy and wellness stipends
• Monthly co-working space membership stipend
• Monthly work-from-home stipend to power your wifi, lunches, coffee, etc
• Pet discount program through United Pet Care
• Financial perks and rewards through BenefitHub
• Free EAP access through LifeWorks
• One-time home office stipend to set up your home office
• Comprehensive parental leave plans
• 9 paid holidays, 1 Alma Mental Health Day, and 1 Alma Volunteering Day
• Unlimited PTO

Alma’s compensation philosophy is driven by our company value of building equity. To best ensure pay equity, we typically bring in new hires near the middle of our listed salary bands and we do not negotiate our compensation (i.e. all people hired at the same level & role are brought in at the same salary, equity, and benefits). The recruiter you work with can provide more details on our philosophy.

All Alma jobs are listed on our careers page. We do not use outside applications or automated text messaging in our recruiting process. We will not ask for any sensitive financial or identification information throughout the recruiting process. Any communication during the recruitment process, including interview requests or job offers, will come directly from a recruiting team member with a helloalma.com email address

job_description:
Job Title: Data Analyst Department: WS

Expected Weekly Hours: 40 Reports to: Operations Manager...

Location: Remote

Pay Range: $48.35 to $50.10/hour

Position Summary

The Data Analyst position is responsible for supporting the client’s business unit by conducting ad-hoc data queries, building dashboards and cleansing, transforming and merging data from different data sources to yield end user insights. If you enjoy generating valuable and actionable business information from data analytics, this position is for you!

Duties And Responsibilities
• Analyze product telemetry data to define KPIs and monitor KPIs to identify developing trends across the product
• Query and transform data from large datasets to produce insights and inform business decisions
• Build Power BI dashboards to enable a self-service environment
• Develop and write in-depth product analysis on end user behavior
• Perform quality assurance on reports to ensure accuracy and consistency
• Work with client product engineering team(s) to extract information that will be used in product development improvements
• Perform other duties as needed.

Job Requirements

Education and Experience: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
• High School Diploma, GED or Equivalent; Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Science or related field preferred
• 2-3 years of experience in an analytical role; experience with software/web based products is preferred
• 2-3 years of experience in extracting, transforming, and analyzing large data sets using SQL or KQL
• 2-3 years of experience in designing and developing visualization solutions using Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent enterprise data visualization software
• Experience using Azure Data Explorer

Qualifications
• Strong verbal and written communication skills; excellent email, telephone and virtual meeting etiquette
• Customer service orientated, ensuring needs are met in a timely fashion
• Ability to talk through a data problem and come up with a way to resolve challenges
• Ability to quickly analyze large data sets and draw inferences
• Ability to take opportunities for continuous improvement and implement documented process improvements
• Ability to work on multiple projects concurrently; demonstrated organization, problem-solving, project management, and time management skills
• Demonstrated strong ability to remotely work well within a team environment, or independently; strong interpersonal and teamwork skills; ability to work and interact effectively with team members from other disciplines, cultures, and organizations
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to effectively inform and present ideas confidently and persuasively to peers and managers
• Ability to take initiative to ask questions, ask for help, or provide updates, without reluctance
• Ability to meet the eligibility requirements for working in the US without RLA sponsorship for employment visa status
• Strong computer skills that include proficiency with MS Office (Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio), Teams and SharePoint

Language Skills
• Ability to read, write, and speak English proficiently

Physical Demands
• While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear.
• Frequently required to stand, walk, sit, use hands to feel; reach with hand and arms, and stoop, kneel, or crouch.
• The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
• Specific vision requirements include the ability to see at close range, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
• At times, may require more than 40 hours per week to perform the duties of the position.

Work Environment
• The position typically operates in a standard office environment.
• This role may use standard office equipment such as computer, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines.

#Remote

job_description:
Apex Systems’ client is seeking someone with an advanced understanding of SQL that is looking to grow their career and further develop their skills in Data Analytics.

If you or someone you know is interested, please forward an updated resume to Peyton Sweren at psweren@apexsystems.com...

Overview

Role: Data Analyst

Location: 100% Remote – Must be able to work on EST.

Duration: Direct hire/ Perm

Soft-skills:

The job will be a great fit if you:
• Are proactive and have a desire to grow your skills and career.
• Have a willingness to communicate in larger meetings and can ask questions and speak up when needed.
• Have a passion and motivation for attention to detail.
• Can effectively communicate your knowledge and understanding of SQL.
• Are open to feedback.
• Are productive and focused on your tasks/assignments. Supports on-site teams with data collection, reporting, interpretation, and analysis. Supports related clinical and operations performance improvement in focused areas by functioning as an analyst, facilitator, consultant, and/or project manager as required. Supports the attainment of improvements in clinical and operational practice to improve the quality and cost of care provided through any of the following: clinical resource utilization, operational assessments, productivity management, and other improvement methods.

Education
• Bachelor's degree in healthcare field Required.
• Master's degree in related field Preferred.

Experience
• 2-3 years' experience in healthcare data systems, analysis, management, and related healthcare consulting; experience supporting customer groups through data analysis and graphical presentation.

EEO Employer

Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at employeeservices@apexsystems.com or 844-463-6178

job_description:
Right Networks offers the only intelligent cloud purpose-built for accounting firms and professionals. Backed by award-winning around-the-clock US-based support, our fully managed IT and applications ensure customers have secure, reliable, on-demand access to their technology. We provide a curated software ecosystem that simplifies the complexity of running an accounting firm or small business... supported by a community of thought leaders, peer networks, and educational resources. Our success is made possible by leveraging decades of specialized experience in leading accounting firms and technology companies. More than 10,000 accounting firms and 60,000 SMBs count on us to run their business every day.

We have a great team, we’re growing fast, and have a winning culture based on innovation, teamwork, and mutual respect.

Job Overview

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Shared Services team reporting to the Director. As this is a new role within the team, this requires the candidate to be a self-starter and can vocalize and communicate effectively, anticipate data consistency issues, respond and reduce impact to internal stakeholders.

This is a remote work position.

Responsibilities
• Creation/Curation of Data Dictionary aligned with Data Governance
• Understand Data Origins within the various data sources + mapping capabilities
• Establish a Change Management Process for source data and data warehouse changes
• Participate in sprints and communicate changes effectively to wider teams
• Accountability and escalation point to identify, address, resolve data issues
• Contribute to ad-hoc projects in support of the wider data governance initiatives

Requirements
• At least 3 years of data analysis experience
• Support development and maintenance of business glossary, definitions, business terms + organizational nomenclature for common vocabulary
• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
• Develop real-time operational dashboards for analytical reports
• Experience with Business Intelligence tools (e.g., PowerBI)
• Strong problem solving and analytical skills
• Outstanding organizational skills and extreme attention to detail
• Ability to work collaboratively with multiple departments across the organization
• Positive attitude and a strong desire to contribute as an essential member of the team

Benefits

To provide best-in-class solutions, we need a best-in-class team. We offer competitive salaries to recruit the best talent. We provide company paid short and long-term disability insurance, life insurance and a generous 401K match. We offer highly affordable medical, dental, vision coverage, and many other valuable benefits. We offer a generous PTO bank, and numerous paid holidays, affording you the time to be there for what is important in your life. We encourage giving back to our communities by providing volunteer paid time off. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

job_description:
The SnapEDA team is growing and we are looking for a talented data analyst to join us. As a data analyst at SnapEDA, you will have the opportunity to work with a passionate and driven team that is constantly raising the bar for quality, throughput, and customer success. You will be responsible for pulling metrics for our advertising customers, preparing metrics presentations, and working on data analytics projects to solve business problems.

A bit about who we are:

SnapEDA created the first search engine for electronics designers, serving over a million engineers every year. We are dedicated to helping engineers create innovative products, from airplanes to medical devices to connected toys. We are a team of passionate individuals who are committed to making a difference in the world of engineering. Come join us and help us make awesome tools for engineers!

Responsibilities:
• Pull metrics for our advertising customers using tools like SQL, MixPanel, and Google Analytics
• Prepare... metrics presentations to share with stakeholders and help drive business decisions
• Work on data analytics projects to solve business problems using data analysis and visualization techniques
• Investigate data anomalies to uncover trends and insights
• Conduct A/B testing of product features to improve performance and drive growth
• Improve data processing and reporting procedures to ensure the accuracy and timeliness of our data

If you are passionate about data analysis and want to make a difference in the world of engineering, we want to hear from you! Come join the SnapEDA team and help us create awesome tools for engineers.

Requirements
• Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related major
-+3 years of related work experience
• Experience with SQL / Excel and python scripting is a bonus
-Excellent communication skills
• Strong technical skills and comfort partnering with technical teams
• Self-motivated and detail oriented with a desire to solve problems

We are a team of passionate individuals who are committed to making a difference in the world of engineering. If you are passionate about data analysis and want to make a difference in the world of engineering, we want to hear from you! Come join the SnapEDA team and help us create awesome tools for engineers.

job_description:
CoinTracker makes cryptocurrency portfolio tracking and tax compliance simple. Our mission is to increase the financial freedom and prosperity of the world.

Some things we’re proud of...

📈 3% of all global cryptocurrency assets are tracked on CoinTracker ($50B daily)

💲 Profitable

🤝 Partnered with Coinbase, TurboTax, OpenSea, and other industry leaders

💼 Venture-backed by Accel, Y Combinator, and other top investors

🗺️ Founders: Jon previously built TextNow (200M downloads), Chandan was previously a product manager at Google

Learn more about our mission, culture, and hiring process.

Your opportunity:

CoinTracker’s mission is to enable everyone in the world to use crypto with peace of mind. As a data analyst, your goal is to take our wide variety of data (blockchains, transactions, usage, mobile/web, etc.) and make it accessible and impact-driven. You’ll be building visualizations, running queries, and helping product, growth, marketing, partnerships, business, and support teams make important decisions and build the best products for the future of crypto.

1-year outcomes:
• Comprehensive dashboards of the user lifecycle (signup, engagement, churn) across our web and mobile platforms.
• Team-specific dashboards launched with KPIs and metrics relevant to the team i.e. Growth, Consumer, Finance, Support, etc.
• Intake process created with a prioritized backlog of data requests for future tools/dashboards.
• Completed pricing analysis to develop new pricing model/experiments for CoinTracker

You will:
• Analyze our ads and marketing data to develop user models and compute LTV and effectiveness of different channels.
• Work with our engagement/churn/retention data alongside product teams to improve product features, measure usage, and manage user cohorts.
• Help develop finance/long-term models and understand tax/portfolio plan purchase and retention behaviors.
• Partner with support to super-charge analytics for support tickets, queues, wait times, and help support be a highly-efficient organization.
• 4+ years experience in Data Analytics

Some of the skills we're excited about:
• SQL Programming knowledge/ability to write queries comfortably
• Experience with Tableau/Mixpanel/etc. for visualization and dashboards
• Curious mindset to dig into datasets and find issues/concerns
• Statistical knowledge to understand p-values, confidence intervals, and impact of experiments
• XFN Collaboration skills to work with PM, Eng, Design, Finance, Support, etc. to gather requirements and provide solutions

What's it like working at CoinTracker?

We are a fully internationally distributed, tight-knit team. We have minimal process, and the majority of our time is spent working and collaborating asynchronously through tools like Figma, Github, Google Meet, Linear, Notion, Slack, Zendesk. We also stay aligned and bonded through weekly sprints, standups, all hands, and socials. We aim to empower every individual on the team with full transparency, ownership, autonomy, and clear objectives. Learn more about our guiding principles.

If this sounds exciting, we'd love to hear from you! Not sure you’re a perfect fit? Reach out anyway. We’re looking for awesome individuals, not folks who perfectly match a job posting
job_description_summary: Our mission is to increase the financial freedom and prosperity of the world. 📈 3% of all global cryptocurrency assets are tracked on CoinTracker ($50B daily) As a data analyst, your goal is to take our wide variety of data (blockchains, transactions, usage, mobile/web, etc.) You’ll be building visualizations, running queries, and helping product, growth, marketing, partnerships, business, and support teams make important decisions and build the best products for the future of crypto. • Team-specific dashboards launched with KPIs and metrics relevant to the team i.e. Growth, Consumer, Finance, Support, etc.

job_description:
About Alchemy Worx:

Alchemy Worx is an audience management agency specializing in email marketing, SMS marketing, and paid social. The agency offers businesses advanced marketing services, utilizing time-tested methods, and procedures to secure a higher rate of customer retention...

In the reporting and analytics process, the team dissects and analyzes the email list, mailing style, and frequency to determine the campaign quality, health, and effectives for email and SMS. After reviewing all KPIs, the analytics team builds predictive models for benchmarking purposes and creates a strategy to hit those benchmarks. In addition, they will look at Facebook Ad Manager to analyze how each campaign is doing and find room for optimization.

We are looking for a tech savvy person who is ambitious and an aggressive self-starter. The ideal candidate should have the ability to manage data analytics, run reports, and excel in a client-facing role.

What You’ll Do:
• Hands-on coding of complex audience selection queries
• Review query requirements and documentation, and develop technical specification documents
• Perform peer review
• Work closely with the internal Campaign Development and BI Operations teams to facilitate campaign readiness as well as deployment activities where required
• Gain a deep knowledge of programs, strategy and data
• Work with broader team on campaign development
• Build / Test / QA audience selection work in Teradata

Who You Are:
• You are a self-starter, problem solver, resourceful and are able to work with limited supervision
• You are flexible and able to manage multiple tasks and deadlines
• You have the ability to work within a globally dispersed team
• You are a strong verbal and written communicator and excellent collaborator that values building strong relationships with colleagues, clients, and other stakeholders
• You have the ability to understand complex topics/processes/problems and explain them to your colleagues in simple terms
• You are customer, results, and solutions oriented

Requirements
• 1 year of experience in a role that required hands-on coding of SQL queries and their integration within a broader platform
• Undergraduate Degree in science, computer science, statistics, mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline

Benefits
• Unlimited PTO policy
• Fully covered medical, dental and vision insurance
• 401k with company match
• Hybrid team, with both main office and remote team members

Alchemy Worx focuses on E-Commerce, Sales and Marketing, Social Media Marketing, Email Marketing, and SMS. Their company has offices in New York City. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at http://www.alchemyworx.com or find them on Twitter and LinkedIn

job_description:
Description

The Senior Data Analyst coordinates with other analytics, IT and business areas across the organization to ensure work is completed with insights from knowledge SMEs. The Senior Data Analyst work assignments involve moderately complex to complex issues where the analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors...

Responsibilities

The Senior Data Analyst leverages its advanced knowledge of data, modeling, optimization, and tools. Applies disciplined analytics to predict behavior and optimize programs and products to maximize revenue growth. Utilizes advanced or predictive modeling to develop, test and validate cases that improve the outcomes and quality of the programs we offer. Contributes to more innovative approaches to financial models as it builds knowledge of the business context in which it operates. Understands and analyzes complex data, articulates to various units within the company at the appropriate level, impacts the business from mathematical concepts which have a potentially sizeable dollar impact on the business. Begins to influence department’s strategy. Makes decisions on moderately complex to complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed without direction. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments.

Required Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree with 5+ years of data analytics experience, or a Master's degree with 3 years of experience
• Experience with data mining, predictive modeling techniques and using data to drive business outcomes and decisions
• Proficient in a programming language such as SAS, Python, Java, Scala, C or R
• Intermediate knowledge of all Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel and PowerPoint)
• Ability to self-motivate & work independently, with a strong attention to detail, to comprehend & analyze data to metrics, to solve problems
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills necessary, with the ability to present findings and insights to senior leadership & other cross functional areas.
• Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences

Preferred Qualifications
• Advanced Degree
• Six Sigma certification
• Expertise in data mining, forecasting, simulation, and/or predictive modeling
• Preferred technologies such as SAS, QL, Python, Power BI, Azure, or similar tools

Additional Information

#LI-ER1

Scheduled Weekly Hours

40
